review: This place is total basura Trash!!!!  Service and food is unacceptable. Should of looked at yelp first. SMH

Lol at the reviews. Not even necessary for me to explain for my bad experience, looks like everyone else just wrote it for me.  But I'll go ahead anyway. Like everyone else has said... TERRIBLE SERVICE! We were 1 of like 4 parties seated on a slow Monday late afternoon. All of the waitresses had no sense of urgency and one even had her back leaning against the wall while having casual conversation with a guest like she didn't have anything else better to do. I made eye contact with at least two waitresses but I guess to them it doesn't mean anything unless you're verbal about being ready to order. Not like that isn't the waitresses job or anything. I don't even know why I give this place a chance anymore.

For a group of 3 people, this place can be a little underwhelming since we waited outside for 10 mins to be seated. Our waitress Jennifer was nice enough to let us know that they are understaffed and there was only one cook and it's going take about 35-40 mind before the food comes out. Knowing that we still waited. Food turned out good and she apologized for the long wait. I'll give this place another go since I feel like we came at A bad time since there was a wildfire going on fairfield.

This location is very hit or miss. The appetizer and entree portion of our visit was fine, I will give them that and service was good until we got to the dessert. My sister ordered the cheesecake, my mom had the lemonade cake, and I ordered their yummy mud pie.  The cheesecake was frozen like they literally took it out of the freezer and served it. My sister basically ate large chunks of frozen cheesecake the entire time. My moms lemonade cake tastes like freezer burn. This cake definitely looked like the frozen store bought SaraLee cake but tastes much worse. After 2 bites, my mom was done.  My mud pie was disappointing. It must have sat for a while because it was melted. The biggest and best part of the mud pie is the whipped cream which you can see is visibly missing from my attached photo. We made our server aware of this minor issue and instead of taking the dessert back and adding whipped cream, she brought me a dollop. Seriously, a spoons worth of whip cream on the side, wth??!! After we brought it to her attention again, she said they were out of whip cream, hmmmm, are you sure? Even if they did run out, she could have made that known to begin with. After speaking to the manager, he took the dessert back and guess what??!! He covered it in whip cream. This is the second visit here where we have had to consult management, I won't be back!

First time at Red Robin here in Solano Mall.. We got here and there were already 3 people waiting in line to be seated.. But we actually did not cut them, my husband just looked for the hostess/host so we can get in but the host grab a menu and seat us first before the other 3 who got there first.. Funny but we went ahead though.. We ordered Salad Grilled chicken platter.. Our server Mike was accommodating and upbeat guy who chatted with us..  Food was completely delish.. Chicken was so tender and yummy as well as their salad with my requested Honey Mustard Dressing.. Going back here for sure..

Seating took 5 minutes. Ordered a drink and the waitress came back to notify they were all out. Ordered within 10 minutes.  I waited 30 minutes for food to come out. Mine and my families food came out over cooked and cold. I told I wanted it pink , it was burnt. My mushrooms tasted fried and burnt. Water had a bad after taste. Waitress did not get my mother sauce that was ordered with initial order. Thanks for a good birthday lunch Red Robin. We will not come back to this location.
The service was  extremely terrible I am not coming back to this restaurant thank you

I hate writing negative reviews of businesses and establishments, but this one has to be written for the benefit of you (as the customer/consumer), and hopefully (if they take the time to read this) the business/establishment to improve upon.. Anyway, my buddy and I chose to eat here as he had won a gift card from his work. We came around 7pmish on Wednesday and we spoke with the seater about getting a seat. We were sat within 15 mins. The wait did not bother my friend and myself. However... roughly 10-12 mins of being sat down at a table, 2 female customers (arriving after us) sat across from us and within literally 3-5 mins, a waitress had come and attended to them... like wow... really?? My friend and I had looked through the menu which only took 5 mins and we waited to be attended only to have the next table who came after us attended first... not only that, but the podium employee attended to both them and made sure their waitress would serve them. My friend and I just literally watched as this was happening and we made eye contact with both the podium employee and waitress to which we were ignored... heck, even a couple who came shortly after that were attended to in a timely manner. As for me and my friend, we were literally ignored! I'm not one for causing a scene or complaining aggressively, but when two tables that arrive after you get served first, and you have to literally get up and look for the server and waitress to inform them that you haven't been served or attended to just goes to show how lacking they are in service. Finally our waitress came and informed us that no one had told her we were seated (as if making eye contact wasn't enough) she apologized and took our order. While the waitress was nice and apologetic, we did not get any sort of complimentary food/drink/discount for the inconvenience. The food to be honest came out mediocre. The fries were hot outside and crisp, but was cold in the inside. The bacon tavern burger was ok, comparable to a Burger King whopper. My friend had ordered the A1 burger which he said was good but the fries were undercooked as well. We were both really hungry and just decided to not waste the food and it all.. our waitress not once even checked if we needed refills on our water. She did come back one time to ask if we wanted more fries to which we happily declined due to the way things turned out. We couldn't wait to leave. Thank goodness we had the gift card and just used that to pay for the meal. So no money really wasted on our end. I know it was a busy and crowded time, but come on.. I've worked in busy restaurants before and I've always managed to serve tables in proper order. We weren't even asked how we wanted the meat cooked.. not that it mattered anyway but in customer service (especially waitressing and serving) you ask specific things your customers want or don't want. We didn't even get that option. I always like to give the benefit of the doubt and assume that they were busy. However, the way service and food was rendered did not justify that. I felt miserable and totally ignored dining at this Red Robin. When I got home my stomach was feeling upset and without going into excessive detail, my digestive system did not agree with the food either. Upon reviewing , I remembered that the fries were undercooked so that may have had something to do with it. Really, my major complaint is that we were ignored and served last as other tables that arrived after us were served promptly. Followed by the mediocrity of the food. I myself will never return and dine at this specific location in the Solano mall. In the end it's up to you to dine here if you want. I recommend reading the other reviews first before you go. Who knows?? Maybe you'll get better service and quality. If I could, this place would get no stars. 0/10.
Cold, horrible food and understaffed service!  Two stars for the good milkshake. Lots of birthdays celebrated there though.

This restaurant used to be very very well and very exciting to go to get a great burger. But since they change the format of the restaurant the burgers not fresh very stale no flavor... there's less fries in there very very greasy. I was a restaurant and I gave it a special for 699 Burger I would make the burgers so you would want to come back unfortunately this restaurant is a restaurant I would definitely avoid going home do not go if you want to feel like you're lonely like they don't pay attention and when you do get the food feels like even punished or you did something wrong sad home a great restaurant has been so bad

Dirty, understaffed, no one cares!  This location is in a mall and has two entrances (we did not know this).  We entered from the parking lot entrance but no one was there, a good while later we walked through the restaurant to discover the mall entrance where we came upon a rather unkempt young man in a dirty uniform shirt standing behind the host stand.  He was totally unconcerned with why we might be there.  We asked for a table and proceeded to wait.  We asked and he confirmed he was responsible for both entrances, he wasn't capable of efficiently managing one entrance let alone two.  No greeting, no acknowledgement, nothing.  He needs to be working on the curb dressed as a liberty tax sign and hopping around for $2 per hour.  We were seated and provided water fairly quickly, then placed an order for two adults and two children about 45 minutes later.  Fries arrived stone cold, no eating utensils provided, the rest was ehhh!  Server was overworked (there were only two for the entire restaurant plus "manager" helping to run food), everything was overlooked, late, or cold.  Trip to the restroom sealed the deal, gross!!!!! This was at 7PM on Sat night, no wonder it wasnt very busy, its a mis-managed dump, go ANYWHERE else.

I really like Red Robin...just not this location...it literally sucks a**. This Fairfield one seriously needs new management because that is the underlying issue to most of the bad reviews. We checked yelp before going but decided that because we like Red Robin that it should be fine and the negative reviews could just be ignored...NO...don't ignore the bad reviews like we did. It is not worth your time and money to go to this Red Robin.  I went here for a birthday lunch with my fiancé, sister, and her boyfriend around 2:00 pm on Sunday July 30. The person who greeted us as we walked in was super nice and had great customer service.  My sister and I have a couple dietary restrictions that are reasonable to work around at these major chain restaurants. The waitress told us the raspberry iced tea came unsweetened so I ordered that. Upon taking my first sip I was overwhelmed with something akin to liquid sugar...the raspberry tea was clearly not unsweetened. When she returned I requested just a regular unsweetened iced tea because the raspberry one and her response was "oh its too sweet?". lightly sweetened and unsweetened are not the same thing....the raspberry iced tea was obviously neither. I can't remember the name but I ordered a black angus fire grilled burger that was one of the higher end burgers available on the menu (~$15). I just wanted a simple burger but this was in the section of the menu where they had "creative" selections. By creative I mean they add a bunch of sugar and fat to it.  The burger I ordered originally came with grilled onions, caramelized bacon bits, cheddar cheese, BBQ sauce, and a brown sugar finish to the burger patty. I requested no cheese, bacon, and brown sugar and for it to be wrapped in lettuce...side note: why would you need to add more sugar to a burger by finishing it off with brown sugar? It just shows you how addicted to sugar people are in America.... We waited not 20 minutes for our food, not 30 minutes, but an hour for our food to be delivered. We were about to walk out when our food came. The waitress kept coming by to tell us it was almost ready. She even gave us some "bottomless" fries to start on while we waited but the two baskets only had like 10 fries each...10 fries is not really bottomless for four people who are waiting an hour for their food.  Finally when we were about to leave, my sister's boyfriend told the manager we were waiting for almost an hour and voila! our food arrives...how convenient. The food was fine but the customer service by management was horrible. They clearly do not know how to manage if a kitchen takes an hour to cook food. The place was not even busy; several tables were vacant. They didn't even tell us why it took so long but our best guess is they made my order regular and realized it was wrong. One table arrived at the same time as us, ordered the same time but left way before we even got our food. The manager did not even comp anything off our receipt for the inconvenience...apparently 10 "bottomless" fries should be satisfactory.  We didn't let the poor overall service that was all on the manager influence the tip for our waitress. She was attentive and provided good service. People like Red Robin and this place would get better reviews if it was more organized and had better leaders for the kitchen staff and the wait staff.

The customer service is poor as well as the food quality. Unfortunately i have eaten here 3x this year and they have  served bad, cold food every time. The worst part is their response to a complaint they show no remorse and not apologetic at all. Thumbs down from me

Picked up large " to- go" order. Was ready when I walked in. Very rare. Kalin, bartender was very helpful and carried order out for me. Connected to mall, so nice location for lunch while doing Christmas shopping...

An hour to get our food on a slow day. I asked for Splenda and was hand given two packs. Saw our waitress twice. Food was bad. And to top it off they brought our kid a chipped plate. Not a spot I go to often but definitely a spot I won't go to again.

If I could give this less I would. We stood waiting to be sat for 15 minutes and no one came to help us at all. Ive eaten here many times but the last few have just been very bad. They either mess up your order, leave you sitting at your table w no drinks or order placed, or like tonight leave you sitting there for so long you just leave. Seems like management needs to get control of the staff.

***This is a late review*** I went here with my children and ordered the hamburgers and towering onion rings.  The onion rings came with a bunch of different sauces which was cool.  All the orders were done on a table tablet.  I don't know if they were trying to be trendy but they had music blurring hella loud. Our table lamp was out and I guess they couldn't find a blub because all the others were on. the table they put us in was located near the restroom so people were always coming and going.  oh yeah, the kicker now. I guess bottomless French fries means an order to be shared amongst the three of us and the waiter disappears only to return with the bill.  we're going to BJ's next time.

Is there a way to give no stars? Terrible customer service waited 20 minutes before anyone even came to ask if we would like waters or drinks. The host even came and asked if we had been helped, I requested to speak to a manager because this is not the first time I've waited a ridiculous amount of time to be helped. Waitresses walked past me as if I was invisible. Spoke to the manager he instantly offered a discount, no thanks! I don't need your hush up discount... finally someone came, didn't greet herself but did take my drink order and food order. Yay! Finally! A few minutes later I finally have a drink with stuff floating in it, gross. Waited another 25 minutes with no one checking in, asking for a refill, nothing! I will not give this location my service anymore, replace this burger place with something else, their service is trash! The waitresses seem like they are unhappy and not open and friendly at all. Gotta add another review for this crappy place called to place an order and was told that they shut down early because their gas line had a leak! I pull up and they still have costumers walking in and out. I walk in the lady discloses oh we're closed while decorating I said ummmm it's actually 15 min untill close. I just wanted some soup. What franchise closes early? One that needs to be shut down! Idk why I keep giving this place a chance. Not to mention I came here with family and the waiters move slower than molasses!
Poor service, long wait, filthy floors.  None of the staff appeared to be happy to be there.   Food didn't even rival Burger King..

it's Red Robin, good burgers, casual dining, kid friendly and in the mall.  Came here and dined with a fairly large group.  Service was decent to good, no complaints.  I ordered the chicken tender salad and the portion size is very generous, but they give you one small dressing.  I guess some people don't want a lot of dressing. Our 9 year old likes coming here- the kids menu is tailored to him....burger, mac and cheese, pizza. Good place for family dining.  Service can be a hit or miss.

Waitress was nice and she kept our drinks filled (she's why I gave any stars). Had 3 upgrades to sweet potato fries, if they weren't cold and hard maybe they would of been good.  We tried endless fries, in hopes of hot fries the second time, they came out just as cold and hard. The burgers pictured looked amazing, all 4 burgers we got were cold, flat and flavorless. We expected big hot juicy burgers and hot sweet potato fries, and we only got disappointed. I try to only give good reviews, but I was just shocked at the poor quality of the food...

Red Robin has always been a nice choice for a quick, tasty, and affordable meal! In the past I've only ventured here for a nice juicy burger or thick sweet milkshake... All of which never disappoint.  But this time I was trying to eat a little lighter so I had their grilled chicken with a Mexican style side salad.  It was awesome!  Also, my sister got a burger meal with fries, and since their fries are bottomless I was able to steal a few.  Their strawberry lemonade is bottomless as well, and I would definitely recommend trying it!  My favorite part of the experience was the fancy touch pad system they have.  You can play games, call your waiter, and even pay the bill on there (they can even split the check!!).  That made it so much easier for everyone.
When the waitress uses excuses like "Off day" after waiting 45 minutes for your food. Then the food is cold and the refills are slow. Not the good times I expected. At least she was apologetic.

I'm giving this location 3 stars  ONLY because we love the food and get seated almost immediately. But on several different occasions, the service has been terrible. On two separate visits, we waited for the waitress to take our order 30min after sitting down, and then after getting our food, we didn't see her the entire time! My boyfriend had to get up and ask another waitress for napkins and then again asked someone else if we could get our bill. That's a bit ridiculous.  The most recent time we went, our waitress was great, but I don't think the rest of the customers had the same experience. A table next to us had gotten the wrong food sent to them, another table had to get up to get their check, and there were about 3-5 tables (with no customers) that had all the plates & mess still on them the entire time we were there!  I don't know if it's a staff problem, a scheduling problem, or what... but dang guys, get with it!!

WORST LOCATION EVER. Just left and made it a must to write this review right away. It's like we were invisible when we sat down. Took 20 minutes to even take our order and only because we had to complain and ask for a manager. He then apologized and said he wouldn't let our table be forgotten again. LIE. We literally waited for 35 minutes then we finally decided to ask for the manager again realizing that it's been almost an hour of us sitting at this same table with no food. It felt even worse because the place started getting empty and were still just sitting there. As we're waiting for the manager to come out, the hostess asked if we wanted refills in the mean time. And brought 2 out of 5 of the refills that we had to ask another waitress for the other 3 in which she gave us attitude.  Someone finally brings out our food. Literally just dropped it off then left. Burgers are usually finger food but we also ordered Mac n cheese and soup so obviously we needed utensils and of course, napkins. Since she left so fast we couldn't ask. My boyfriend got really upset and walked to the kitchen to talk to the manager that never came out.  It was a different manager this time named Josiah. After he heard from us, he was very sincere and offered to take care of our bill considering that our experience was ridiculous. Thank you Josiah for doing that but please fix this location and your staffs attitudes. The whole time only the hostess (barely) and the manager actually helped us.  As were walking out, the waitress that was suppose to be ours steps in front of us, "did you pay?" With this dumb little neck roll. She really had the audacity to have an attitude with US like we did something wrong. Did you help me at all tonight? No. Did you serve us? No. You have the time to ask us if we paid but where were you the whole time we were there? Ignoring us and only came at the end behind the manager pretending you actually cared. I just wanted to slap the dumbness off her face with her sick attitude. The manager had came out right after she asked us and told her it was okay. Hope she felt dumb.  While we were there, a table of 4 by us was so upset that when the food finally came out to their table, they walked out and left. Another table of 5 by us started complaining because we were damn near almost done with our food and they barely just got their drinks. It was just so horrible in there...

Awesome service. Awesome machines to pay and go from your table. Awesome servers. The host was absent a few times but everybody's nice. The food is Great! Fast service! Greatly made adult drinks. THANK U RED ROBIN!

Super disappointing experience I had tonight with my family. We came in at 9:00pm an hour before closing and were the only ones seated in dining. David, the host, was great, he greeted us and was very helpful.  We didn't really have any problems until it came to our food. Some of our entrees came out around 9:50 - 10pm, pretty much closing. We finished 3/4ths of our meals before the next two peoples arrived. One being a side salad that came out warm after my entree. We ended up taking the salad off and sweat potato fries that we didn't know were out until about an hour later. Even worse, we had a soup that never made it out because it was taking too long. Even better, when we went to check they were just making it.  Once we had some food, they were quicker on giving us endless fries and some ranch. However the miss communication with the staff really messed up the experience. As a former server this was very disappointing because we would of understood any delays if they were reasonable. I think our server tried her best, maybe she's new but we could tell she was overwhelmed with us.  Additionally, if they were closing down the kitchen, we would of much rather been turned away. I understand it's a Monday but we were left in the  dark on how long food was taking and so on. Management tonight said he'd communicate it with another manager, however we still felt dissatisfied with how everything went down.
Ordered take out from here about two weeks ago. The food was great but the customer service sucked and the lady was rude. Not cool.

I usually really like Red Robins, I love french fries so the fact that they offer bottomless fries is awesome!! But this location is HORRIBLE. THEIR CUSTOMER SERVICE IS THE WORST. The servers are so SLOW and LAZY. We waited over 30 minutes before someone took our order.  Since we were seated by the kitchen I could see what was going on in the back. I saw our food ready and just sitting there for over 20 minutes while our waitress stood there chatting it up with another waitress, while stuffing their face with fries. I understand that they also need to eat, but they're on the clock. They have breaks for that. By the time we got our food, we were starving. My burger was a little cold to be honest, but I was hungry so I ate it anyway. When I asked our server for a refill on my fries she said "sure" and never came back with them. My friend wanted to order a drink later into our meal, but again our server was no where to be found.  After an hour of waiting for our server to return, we decided to just leave. We got so tired of waiting for her that we ended up just playing the bill on the little machine thing on the table. When we were paying, our server finally comes back and asks "you guys doing good?" and leaves before we can even reply. Still didn't bring my fries, didn't ask if we wanted refills on our drinks or if we wanted dessert. Nothing. Horrible service.  This location is also really dirty. When we first arrived there, a few tables next to us hadn't been cleaned yet, we were there for over 3 hours and they still didn't clean them. Our table was also sticky and we had to wipe it down ourselves with a napkin and some of our water. It's a shame, cause this place is in the mall, would have been convenient to go to after shopping, but don't do it!!! DON'T GO TO THIS PLACE. THEIR FOOD IS DECENT, BUT THE CUSTOMER SERVICE JUST RUINS IT ALL!!!!! SMH.
Despite all the negative reviews, at least for me, tonight, service was excellent. Food was good I got the prime rib dip and sweet pot fries and it comes with byiur choice of dipping sauce.

Very disappointing (at least this location)  Once I was seated about 15 mins passed and still no server...so I tried to figure out the self serve computer they had at the table to order myself...this computer wasn't working right...so I hit the "call server" button and it started flashing...even with this I still had to wait about 10 mins before I was even noticed...so the server finally came and I place my order (25 mins) after being seated....another 20 mins passed with no word no food...waited 5 more minutes and then decided to get up and walk out...needless to say this place has lost my business

Never going here again . We get sat down first thing I see is a cockroach walking back and forward.  We actually ordered and we got cold hard fries and the burger was cold . If you want a burger your better off going to McDonald's.

location: Travis Air Force Base, Travis Air Force Base, CA
review: Looks can be deceiving. My whiskey bbq burger looked good but was burnt. I realize the place is located in a mall but it needed cleaning. My husband got the blue ribbon burger and it was perfect but mine was inedible. The server is the only other positive thing about this place. Yes she did remove the burger from bill.

I just took my girls to Red Robin. One of the waitresses saw us as soon when we walked in and she said she'll be right with us. Waited for over 5 mins to get seated even though the restaurant is not busy. So I decided to walk over the Buffalo Wild Wings instead since my girls are hungry. At least they seated us as soon when we walked in. Never again will not come to Red Robin. Smh!

No no no no nooooooo! Did I say no? Stay away! I'm here today for a second try, as we had a bad experience the first time. I usually love Red Robin and am a huge fan of the chain. This location, however is worse than horrible. Twice now we have received agonizingly, mind numbingly slow service, cold food, and terrible value.  Top this off with an obnoxious waitress, and you have the perfect storm of terrible experience. I've given it two chances to shine. Next time I want a burger for $12, I'll just cross the street to Fudruckers.

Bartender was awesome!!! We were there on 8/7 and she was very patient and funny.  We would definitely go back because of her.  This was right before closing time.  Every time we asked her to make a drink that had a certain flavor, she would make up her own drink and they were amazing.

**only put 1 star cause i couldnt put no star** So i went to this Red Robin because i was already in the mall with my 3 yr old daughter, amd i been there a long time ago and enjoyed it. Got seated right away then waited... waited.. waited for bout 15 min for our waitress to come and ask if we wanted drinks. Then waited 5 more minutes to take order (i ordered a burger and fries and my daughter ordered corndog bites) so 20 min into being there i noticed  3 families(white families) coming in (place wasnt busy) 2 families with 4+ ppl. Mind you we were the only colored ppl eatin. Well some how some way all 3 families get their food before us (mostly burgers). After waitin bout an hour and asking the waitress to check on our order 3 times mind you the second time i told her i just want my daughter's order out asap, We get our food. My burger(cheese already looked hardened)  and fries were cold my daughters food was warm. I sent mine back but my daughter was starving so she ate hers, i didnt eat cause didnt want to wait more. I spoke to manager and asked if it was a racial thing cause i see no other reason for our food to take so long and the fact the other families got their food so fast and they ordered same thing as me. He says its not cause they hire all kinds of people, then i asked why would no one bring me my food then? Especially since i had my daughter with me had no answer. He didnt charge me for my daughters food but honestly worse experience ive ever had, literally  felt like i was 100% discriminated against for no reason.

I have been to this Red Robin on several occasions. And I have to say the customer service is really bad. My last visit on 1/11/17 was probably the best service I have received. Unfortunately I went to lunch with my cousin and we both became ill. We shared both items we ordered. We ordered the chili con queso and the A1 peppercorn burger.  So I called today to inform the management of the problem. Again the customer service was horrible the first time I called.  I was placed on hold for over 15 minutes and never actually spoke to a manager. I hung up and called back and finally got to speak to a manager. The manager was polite and apologized for the problems. Needless to say I probably won't be visiting this Red Robin again.

If you're in the mall, shopping in other close vicinities, or hungry for some bottomless fries & a few variety of drinks, this place might just be for you. Wait time is usually between 15-30 minutes for seating, especially during the holidays. But drinks will always come right away. Definitely try their onion rings, which they serve stacked up. Service is alright, definitely didn't receive that much love from our server but it was busy. Food took awhile to arrive (we did see it sit under the hot light for awhile before making its way on our table). Food didn't arrive hot, in fact, my mother had to send it back because it wasn't to her liking. But other than that everything was okay. Food isn't like "wow amazing" but it'll get the job done. Staff did seem friendly & nice. A bit fatigued from the holidays but that is natural and okay. Overall 3/5.

For the third visit in one year I'm disappointed at the service. It has not improved. I normally go to Vacaville Red Robin but I've decided to give Fairfield Red Robin a chance. Overall issue is poor service. My waitress was not attentive and failed to provided spoon/forks and napkins. I've tried to get her attention but she doesn't seem to care. Instead I had to get napkins from the restroom. I don't plan on eating here for 2017.

I've been coming to this Red Robin for about 6 years now. I've signed up for the free birthday meals and I've signed up my kids for the free birthday meals. My family and I always participated in the free birthday meal for me and my kids in the past (We are a working family and want to be resourceful with our money). Anyway Angela was the one to help us on my sons special day. This was the first time any of us got ice cream. My husband, my kids or I never got ice cream before this. Angela made this a great day for my son! Thanks Angela!!!

My sister and I wanted to try this location after shopping. We were actually at this location's front entrance waiting to be seated for several minutes. As we sat there, more customers walked in. Unfortunately (?) for us, as soon as they arrived, a waitress walked past and sat those 2 groups before us. That waitress somewhat acknowledged us that we'd be seated next. Not a big deal, we weren't in a hurry. Next thing we knew, another group came in and a different waitress passed by to get them seated. Oh well, not a big deal... I guess? Guess what! Another set of people came in and the first waitress showed up to seat that set of people, too... Totally dismissing us! We sat there for a bit and looked at each other with our rumbly tummies echoing in unison... "Yeah, let's go elsewhere...", we thought to each other. Kinda poor on the customer service... and kinda glad we didn't go either thanks to all the reviews here. We're happily eating elsewhere now.

I would caution any shoppers at the Solano Mall to look at their food before they eat ... first off, we had to find someone who would seat us. Once we got a booth table, I noticed pizza and other large scraps under the table. There's flags we're flying high but it was late and we decided to stay. Big mistake.  My husband ordered the Bruschetta Chicken sandwich ... he noticed the chicken had an odd taste after a couple of bites and looked at the sandwich - it was raw inside!  We told the server, who seemed nonchalant about it. Although she deducted the meal, we felt the situation could have been dealt more appropriately, such as having the manager come talk to us. In fact, I left my food as well but it wasn't deducted.  So, should you choose to eat at this place, please look closely at your meal. But I would highly recommend you try the other restaurants in the nearby area before settling for RR.

Maybe another 5 minutes goes by and the server comes over and asks what I need. I tell her, I'd like to place an order to go. She tells me that the bartender is on the way, maybe another 5 minutes. She goes on to tell me that it's better to order online.  My main issue here is the lack of customer service. Not everything needs to be online, almost every other location I've been to offers great service. This was disappointing. I worked in the service industry and I know it's not easy and the most rewarding career and I dont want to break anyone's balls here and maybe the issue is above the staff here, maybe it's chain trying to adapt to technology. My advice here is stick to the basics. Have problem solvers and don't let people wait 10-15 minutes to order take out.  I left without placing an order, opting to go someplace else.  If the management team is reading this, do something about this. Look at your reviews here, this seems to be a long standing issue with customer service.
Food was great the menu had really good selections the wait time was very minimal waiters/waitresses were very polite if your looking for a good burger at a good price then you have to try this place

Service is consistent. Consistently SLOW.  Plus I ordered a "Smoke & Pepper" burger. Which the menu states is topped with "black pepper bacon." My burger arrived with plain bacon. When I pointed out to the waitress that my peppered bacon was missing she assured me she would fix it. She came back to my table with a plate that had 3 pieces of bacon that someone had sprinkled pepper on. Pathetic! That was two years ago and we have not returned since. If you want a good burger I'd highly recommend Fudruckers which is conveniently near by.

Noticed that they had a remodel and hoped maybe service and food is better... didn't even get the chance to eat... We where seated and that is about the extent of our visit. I should have taken the warning before we where seated. One server asked what happened to some table and the hostess commented they just walked out. I started to notice two tables that where seated after us where being asked their drink order and we still have not seen our server. I decided to set my timer for fifteen minutes and if we still didn't see our server we will walk out.  15 minutes later we walked out... won't ever be coming back here...

Food is good for a burger joint. Service was AWFUL tho. The waitress was nice enough, but spent most of her time looking at pics on a customer's phone. We sat idle for quite a while waiting on food to arrive. Plus, another waitress had to come help us when we first arrived and waited at our table for about 8 minutes because our waitress was "tied up."

The Food and Service has gone down badly...the ONLY thing good here are the Steak fries...maybe. Burger or 2... My wife ordered French Onion Soup. It used to be REALLY good here but when she got it there was a fair amount of cheese, a lot of bread and barely any soup! Wth? It's SOUP! Also when she did eat the soup there was a beef broth cube she bit in to!!  And the Unlimited fries, the waitress was Fry Police! Making sure I ate all the fries before getting another order. BAD, Really Bad!

I brought my niece for lunch and my waitress kept blowing us off. I waved her down to let her know we were ready to order and then she asked me to use the tablet instead. Then when she brought the food she said "Oh; and if you guys can pay on the tablet, that would be great. My manager wants me to clear this table." She asked us to eat quickly and then came around to clear tables and said to leave the tip under the empty glass. I would be zero stars if possible.

Slow service and took forever for them to bring food.  Bottomless fries.... right.... the orders they brought weren't even half full.  Spend less time flirting and more time paying attention to your customers.

The food was good although my burger was bright pink and I asked for no pink. But the service was terrible. We asked if we could have our shakes come with our food but she said, "Well I'm already entering it in so you'll want it to come when its ready." How about quit entering in into the tablet and we will order it later...? She was too lazy to do that. So our shakes came 15 mins before our food and we had no choice but to drink them. Then she dropped off our food and never came back. She didn't even get me a chance to say, "Can we get ranch too." She ran off. Never stopped by and checked if we needed ANYTHING or if our food was ok. Never asked if we needed refills. I barely got any fries so we wanted to get more, well she never came so we couldn't get any. We sat there for a good half hour eating and nothing. We always have bad service here but at least they check in on us. We don't have a lot of food options in Fairfield so it's really frustrating to find a decent place to eat.

I work in this mall so I come here every once in a while. The service every time is bad and the food is the worst for any Red Robin I've been too.  I am sitting here right now and the server Eden is quite rude.

The first trip to this restaurant in the Solano Town Center Mall was horrible! Slow service, cold food (and I mean the queso tasted like it had just come out of the refrigerator), snotty service (the server threw the check at our table as she ran through the dining room). I swore I would never go back again!!!! However, I found myself back at the Solano Mall Red Robin Burgers and thought I would give it another try. Everyone has a bad day and deserves a second shot. This time was much better, good service, hot food, an over all great experience.  The burgers are a little pricey in my opinion, but tasty and sizeable. The free refills on steak fries was interesting...I had never seen that before.  I have to give this an average rating because I have had a 50/50 experience (both good and bad). I am not sure I will rush back to try it again, but I won't avoid it either. Seems a good choice if you are in the mall, hopefully you will have more good experiences than bad.

Such a disappointment! First we waited forty minutes just to get our iced tea and the place wasn't even busy. Next, we got our COLD onion ring appetizer without napkins. How the heck do you eat onion rings without napkins??! Then our food sat out so long before they brought it to us that the burgers were cold! We told the waiter to just box up the food, because we were tired and done! The waited then blamed everyone on the Red Robin, saying its the way they are set up. WHAT?! Finally, after paying the $45 check without any discount we decided to write to corporate, only to get a canned email response WITHOUT APOLOGY and a $25 gift card to come back. Yeah, right!

This was my second visit to this RR in a year. Same experience...15 min wait for table...30 min wait for 2 beers and one Jack & coke...our server was awesome she did the best she could with the support staff she has. Idk what the problem is with this RR it was not busy lastnite I think RR should just close this restaurant! #givinguponredrobin

Our burgers were overcooked they didn't come with extra sauce like we asked the service was very slow. We only ate half of each of our burgers. That was all we could stomach. When we complained the manager was kind enough to give us a 25% discount. How are that didn't even add up to the price of one Burger. I should have checked Yelp before we went there

While I do like Red Robin's burgers/sandwiches, this is without a doubt the slowest RR, in regards to service.  I think the manager tries to cut labor costs or something, cause they always seem understaffed.  Food gets 4 stars from me, but after coming to this location several times since we moved to this area, I am deducting 2 stars cause of extremely slow service every time.  I've never been to another RR with this continual issue.

Love the burgers here at Red Robin. Food is pretty good, but sometimes my burger is not cooked medium like I requested. The fries this visit were just the right amount. This recent visit we got seated right away. The down side was the wait. We waited a while for someone to get to us. I hit the button on table top system and multiple people and the manager passed it. I think creating a better flow in the restaurant will help. Add someone from kitchen to watch water levels (soda) and keep them full. Check on fries as well. Or manager should walk around and make sure people are acknowledging the tables that have no waters or look as if they are waiting to be serviced.

Went to dinner tonight at 7:00 pm.  Wednesday evening and not very busy.   Took over half an hour to get our food.   Food was substandard and one of our meals was incorrect.   We were given two napkins that we had to share between the three of us.   Our sodas and iced tea glasses were never refilled.   Restaurant was dirty and wait staff were nonchalant and unconcerned with our needs.   Will NEVER eat here again!

Went to RR in Fairfield on 7/12/17 a Wednesday night right before 6 pm.    Not busy.  Staffing adequate.   But it always happens.   Service and food are always slow to the table.   Food was warm at best.  Fries were barely warm.  2 burgers. Kids mac n cheese. Kids pizza.    It's a shame because the Vacaville RR is completely different everytime we go there.  Hot food and good service

Love that this is located in the Mall, makes is convenient for pre- or post movie bites.  Hit and miss with service though.   Careful on trying to special order dishes - 50/50 chance that they get my Son's cheese pizza no sauce order correct from the kiddos menu.  And while I can appreciate new plate ware, was it really necessary to cut the salad and soup portions down so much with the change?   The newly updated interiors are nice though.  Gives a fresh modern vibe.   **** Last note, and request for Red Robin.  You put those fancy appetizer, drink order machines on the table.... But we have to sit here for 5 - 10 min once we get here for our waitress to come over to take our drink and appetizer order to use it.... Defeats the purpose wouldn't you say?   Can you have those activated as part of the initial seating process please?  ****

I'm giving this location two stars because I have had decent experiences in the past. Unfortunately, our last visit ended before we were seated. Rather sad for the restaurant...they missed out on our large order, plus tips and future business.  We were given a wait time and then waited twice what they had said. This is due to the hostess writing a 5 next to our name. When she asked my husband "how many children" and he said 5, she forgot to record the two adults also present. So, that should have been a "7". Didn't have to be a big deal. Everyone makes mistakes. But when I asked about a table that was vacant, the hostess was snotty and defensive.  Then when my husband said "never mind", she *shrugged* and did not offer an apology for the inconvenience, etc.  I will not give our hard-earned money to a place that has that representation at their front desk.   Good news is that Fuddruckers is a short drive away.  That's where we ate that night and had a great experience!

Waited at an empty hostess desk for 20 minutes. She sat us at the bar and the table was dirty, when I asked her to clean it, she got upset but she cleaned it nonetheless.  On the other hand, we ordered buffalo wings but they were burned. Ask for another batch that's not burned and it came back burned. The fries were cold and stale  and it was skimpy. Not a good experience, I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

If I could give this place NO stars, I would. I don't care how nicely updated your restaurant is. I was ignored by 3 different people, 2 employees & what appeared to be a manager due to his attire. One girl even stared at me while she went to answer the phone. Been here years ago when people actually liked the place. NEVER AGAIN. the staff even looked trashy.

Burgers are decent and decent price. The good stuff stops there. Service is super duper slow. I have given up eating here because service is too slow for my level patience.  Today I ordered a burger to go, you'll see they gave me very little fries on what is an order which comes with bottomless fries if you eat there!

Came to this location about half a year ago. I felt like the food was WAY over charged & the waiter had an attitude. Thought I would give it one more shot.  This time was WAY WORSE. It wasn't even that busy but it still took over 20 minutes for just our drinks to get to the table( it was already sitting waiting at the bar for 10 minutes) other than that. My glass was served to me only HALF FULL!! If I decide to pay for my alcohol, I would prefer a full glass.(As would anyone) While waiting for the food, all I can hear are the waitresses gossiping. Small pieces of plastic on the rim of my glass. Just too much for me wanting to enjoy my Saturday night out.

My son, 6 years old, and myself, clearly 6 months pregnant, was not impressed with this visit... was so close to walking out. First off, it took me and another party 15 minutes to be noticed at the entrance from the mall to be seated when other employees clearly walked right by us. Two, a man walked in after the girl seated the party before me and when she came back, as I was clearly standing in front of the podium and he was seated first. RUDE! Third, it took my son 15 minutes to get a smoothie drink from the bar. Lastly, after eating, plates empty, it took me 20 minutes just to get my bill because I wanted to pay in cash. Let's just say I gave up waiting and paid with my card on the kiosk and left. NOT coming back...  My server was fine and had a good attitude even when mine was clearly disappearing.

Poor customer service, waitress never checked on us, messed up drink and food orders, and after waiting 15+ minutes for our check we finally had to get up and find someone to pay for poor customer service! This place use to be great to come to but now it has gone down the drain due to poor staff.

Well haven't been to this location in 18 months or so, since they have done remodel. At bar, slow service, they mess up the couples food next to me, they mess up my order, place has gone Down hill, will not be coming back, ever.

Orders a burger with no lettuce or tomato. Comes with all that and sauce. Tell the waiter how I order it they say we'll make you another right now. Takes my burger to the kitchen. Has it for like 8 minutes. Brings it back cold with stuff clearly scraped off. What if I'm allergic to tomatoes? Like come on. This place is trash.

This place sucks! We have been here for over an hour and have not even received our food yet! Im writing this review as i am still waiting! Its like they are ignoring everyone on this side of the restaurant! I have only seen the waitress once and that was when we first sat down to get our drinks!

I was skeptical about the reviews on here before visiting the location myself. I'm a fan of Red Robin in general and I couldn't imagine one location being so much worse than others. I was wrong.  When we arrived, there was a couple ahead of us, waiting on the hostess who was taking an order of some kind on the phone. Had she acknowledged the 4 of us it wouldn't have phased me but we were all standing there kind of confused instead.  After we were seated the waitress seemed to be engaging and kind so I didn't think much of the previous interaction. Unfortunately, after we ordered things began to fall apart. It took quite a while just to get our chips and salsa. When it arrived, the chips were soaked in grease, about an inch of which had collected on the bottom of the bowl. The guac and salsa also had a strange, sour taste to them. Our entrees took twice as long and were just as lack-luster. Our salads were not the normal size I receive at other locations, this was much smaller (not worth the $11) and there were more onions than there was lettuce. The lettuce itself was soggy and discolored.  TLDR: the food and service at this location is no where near the quality of other Red Robin establishments. Believe the ratings here.

Horrible horrible service. The second we were seated we were greated by a gentlemen. He had asked us if we had already been helped. I told him we just got seated like literally 4 seconds ago, but no we have not been helped. He asked us what we would like to drink. So we skimmed through the drink menu feeling a little rushed and just ordered a freckled lemonade, a purple lemonade and a kids lemonade. He then tells us "ok! I am not your server so I cant get those for you, so I will just go ahead and put in a water." Wtf? Really??? What was the point of that?  A couple minutes later our server then came by took our orders, and told us our drinks were on the way. She was very nice but was not attentive to us at all. She would ask how we were doing and when we answered "good, but can we get...." she cuts us off before we can finish and says "great! Let me know if you guys need anything!" And walks away so fast that we dont even get a chance to stop her. We had to ask for everything ourselves! Refills, more fries (bottomless), more salad (bottomless). Not once did she ask "would you like a refill?" Or more fries?" When I did get my refill, I could see another server asking each table in front of ours asking if they had ordered a purple lemonade with my drink in her hand. She finally got to our table and before she could ask I just looked at her in frustration and said "yes! That is mine." She apologized and said it was put in for the wrong table. A few seconds later, another guy came by our table with another purple lemonade and said "oh, you got it already?" And then walked away like I was the one who made him bring the drink. I then saw him hand it out free to another table around the corner. We left here still hungry because we were hoping to just eat a burger, and eat the bottomless sides until we got full, but we never even had the chance to ask or be asked for some. We will never be coming here again for a while...

This place lets a kid go starving. My kid was complaining she was hungry.  Server takes orders who were seated next to us 10 minutes after we were seated. Server call light was on for 10 minutes to try and get our orders in. My family got up and walked, informed the person who sat us down we were leaving so our table was free... Nope. I've come here numerous times to give them another chance but never ever again will I give them my business.
Didn't even eat... 4:30 on a tues with maybe 5 other people there. After waiting 15 min and still not ever a water run we went upstairs to Applebee's. No wonder they only have 2 stars.

Got here at 850... Plenty of time before closing. Was seated. Took a while for our server to come see us. 15+ minutes. It's DEAD in here. -___- Our food is STILL not out an hour after our arrival.  Mmk. Food got here. My Mac and cheese for my kid came last because apparently it spilled in the kitchen. -____- Kid's food should be first. My teriyaki Chicken sandwich is always good. Mom didn't like her Bonzai salad... Shitty quality she said. Dad's garlic fries were over cooked and soaked in oil. It also used to be fresh garlic and Parmesan and now it's some lame garlic powder that doesn't stick to the fries. GROSS!  The quality service and food that once existed here is NO MORE. *sigh*

The worst experience ever. We waited ten minutes after we were seated for anyone to greet us or take our drink orders. We then waited 25 minutes for our appetizer. Our food came 35 minutes later and our burgers and fries were cold. My husband requested a manager and marcio/marciano came by, he offered to remake my burger, but considering I had less then 10 min before the movie started that wasn't an option for us. The manger never apologized or tried to give an explanation. Unapologetic which is unacceptable! Our bill was full priced he didn't even give a discount. I will never go back!!! Terrible service

This was THE worst restaurant experience I have had in quite some time.  I thought the Applebee's in the Solano Town Center Mall was bad, but Red Robin managed to outdo them last night. I gave them the benefit of the doubt at first, it was after all 8:30 on a  Saturday night at the mall, so I figured we'd have to wait a little bit.  Plus we were a party of 5 with a small child.  However, the hostess stand was unattended when we got there, and it took at least 5 minutes before we even got a "someone will be right with you" from a passing server.   5 more minutes passed until someone did actually come over and seat us.   Even after pressing the "call server" button on the little computer thing on the table, we didn't see a server or even get offered so much as water for the next fifteen minutes.  Just as we were about to leave (after watching the couple at the table behind us walk out, presumably for the same reason), the server finally showed up.  We ordered drinks and food all at the same time, hoping to expedite the process.  My friend's little niece had also asked our server very politely for some crayons for her coloring page, which she never got.  I had to get up and go over to the STILL unmanned hostess stand and get them myself.  TWENTY minutes later, the drinks show up, and one of them was wrong. One of my friends ordered the bottomless root beer float.  The glass was maybe half full, with about a quarter of that being root beer. It looked pretty putrid. We're just about finished with our drinks, still no food.  Once again, we were considering just paying for those and leaving, since it was approaching 9:30 at this point, but we were so damn hungry by then we waited.  Two of our meals arrived, not brought by our original server.  We still had no napkins or silverware in front of us.  I asked this server if we could please get some silverware and such, she basically dismissed me, set down the other meal and walked off.  Thanks. My friend seated to my left got his burger, and it had been sitting under a heat lamp so long the bottom bun was completely soggy with burger juice.  My other friend's sandwich was almost cold.  I will say that the food, once we got it, was the best part, and even that wasn't anything to rave about.  We finally got silverware and napkins, unwrapped, and plopped down in front of me on a plate, which I guess it was up to me to distribute to everyone at the table.  Not once did a server ask us how everything was, did we want more drinks, one of my friends couldn't even get a refill on her water.   The place looked disgusting.  Tables weren't being bussed, garbage and food all over the floor by the tables from kids, fruit flies buzzing around.  When it came time to pay, one of us had to go get the check ourselves.  Then when we paid, we had to take the credit card up to the server station ourselves, and there was a LINE to do so.  Our group was waiting to leave as our friend who was treating waited to get his credit card back.  He was just standing there, for 5 minutes or more.  I finally got fed up, walked over and asked him, "Do they still have your credit card?"  He said yes.  I hollered at the 4 or 5 people milling around, "How long does it take to run a credit card??  Let's go!"  I don't like being pushed to have to speak to people like that, but the service in this location is beyond awful.  However, this was what was necessary to finally get his card back, as it magically appeared all of a sudden with the receipt.  Not sure about you, but I get a little suspicious when my credit card disappears behind the scenes for that long. The odd thing was, it really wasn't THAT crowded in there, so I'm not sure what was keeping the servers so tied up other than poor staffing and even poorer management.  This will now be the second restaurant in this same mall that I will never visit again.  I don't know if it's the mall management, or Red Robin themselves, but this location needs a serious overhaul, and fast.  I've eaten here previously and it was decent all around, not sure what happened, but judging by other reviews on here, this wasn't a one time thing last night. If I hadn't been with a group of friends, my patience would have run out much sooner.  It's pretty bad when the 4 year old was able to keep her cool better than I was.

A friend and I decided to grab a quick bite to eat after returning something at the mall. We decided to sit in the bar at Red Robin thinking the service would be faster and grab a quick meal before having to pick up my kids from school. We sat down right away and drinks were ordered and delivered reasonably fast-about 5-8min. But we ordered our food and waited 40-45 minutes before I got up and said something. Two other tables of 1 to 2 people were given their food even though we were there first. We had not ordered anything complicated just a burger and a chicken burger but our food never came and we were running out of time and the store wasn't even busy. The food was given to us in Togo boxes because I told them I had no more time to sit there and eat. The manager was very nice and apologized for the wait as other people were starting to get upset as well. The server never really came back. The manager did comp our food and it tasted pretty good I just wished the speed of service hadn't been so long and lacking. 2 stars for the food- zero stars for our nonexistent waitress.

Service was NOT good. Still waiting for our food. Staff seems a bit dysfunctional and out of sorts.  Trying to come in to a respectable restaurant and feed the kiddos. But still waiting, very frustrated and disappointed

Ate here Saturday, May 13th  I would give this no stars if I could.  My son and I rarely eat out!  $28 later, we waited 15 minutes before being offered drinks.  Table wasn't cleaned properly.  I had to remind the waitress for to bring our drinks (20 minutes later), all the silverware was dirty, salad had no avocado, not much chicken ($14.00 salad) my sons burger was a sloppy mess and his first round of fries were cold. It took us an hour to get our food.  Bus employees were lazy.  Manager was very nice; however our meals should have been comped because it was SO bad!  Will not go back.  I wish I would contact the owner.  It was awful!  Waste of my money.  Never again.

They always want you to write a huge review. But a picture says a thousand words. Everybody walked past the trash on the floor, and the blue shop towels. Weird. They say we're all going to be replaced by robots in the workplace. When I see this I believe I'm getting a glimpse of why that will happen.

Despite the manager's attempt to appease us by lowering our bill after a TERRIBLE visit, I still must give this place 1 star! Walked in and two hostesses were gabbing away so it was a minute before we were seated. When she finally brought us to our table, it still had dirty dishes on it from the previous customers. She removed the items and motioned for us to sit down. I kindly asked her to wipe the table down and she did. Why would you bring us to a dirty table in the 1st place?? It was over 15 minutes before a server came to our table. The people next to us got up and left because they were sick of waiting for someone to help them. Anyway, she took our orders and brought me back a soda that tasted foul, then she disappeared. About 25 minutes later another server brought out our food and handed me my plate that was scalding hot with no warning, which burnt my finger terribly. She apologized but by this point I was furious!! I asked to speak with the manager and he apologized as well and brought me a new drink and brought my boyfriend's avocado they had forgotten. Our first server came back around to check on us and I explained how my finger was burned because of the server and she said "B!tch" referring to her co-worker and laughed... Completely unprofessional! I have been to this Red Robin numerous times in the past and the service has been ok. Today was probably the worst service I have ever had anywhere!  Instead of using all that money to remodel the restaurant, they should use it to hire more employees and train them correctly!

Well, our family gives every restaurant 3 tries to earn my business.  The third try tonight was the worst.  I would give this location no stars if I could.  The service was TERRIBLE, the food came to us completely cold and they over charged my bill.  We walked in at 5:50 pm sharp with plenty of time to eat before our 7:20 pm movie.  Our food didn't even get to us until 7.  We ate what was edible (which was my cold salad) and barely made the end of the previews.  I ordered a drink and my husband a beer and it didn't arrive until my food did.  I know they make their money in alcohol.  They missed the opportunity to get a second drink out of us. I will highly discourage anyone to visit this location.  We are very big supporters of our home town restaurants.  This one is certainly off our list.

Update: I highly suggest anyone with a complaint go to the Red Robin website and contact guest services. I got a quick response with a gift card. The gift card will be used at a different location.  I don't even write reviews but this place sucks. Waited to have our order taken for 15 mins before getting up & leaving. Asked to see the manager on the way out & he just said, "oh". Definitely reporting this to corporate.

I witnessed a manager I believe he was a tall white man, yelling at a server in a way he shouldn't be talking to his employees . This Red Robin was horrible in every way . Although my server Emma was very sweet and apologized for the outrageous time it took for us to get our food, it was still unacceptable. She made our visit nicer though.. made sure we had fries throughout our visit and engaged in small talk with us all while taking care of all her tables . But that one manager should be looked into for the way he speaks to his employees

Very slow service. No bus boys so the waitresses have to bus their own tables. The restaurant is way too large for the staff to handle. Full of typical mall rat type people who are an eyesore to look at. They were standing around our table watching the football game on the TV that was above our booth.  The bleu ribbon burger actually turned out to be really good after the long wait. Much better than I expected. However I still could have gone to Fuddruckers across the street and eaten in the time it took to wait here anyways. Fuddruckers has better beer and make your own burger too with tons of meat selections like bison.

This particular restaurant is a total joke. I've been here a handful of times and each time I leave thinking "why did I come back to this place?!". The service is consistently terrible - waitresses who could care less and management that needs to step up and get their employees in gear. This last visit was a to-go order (we assumed just call it in and skip the tremendous wait times). Had to call three times. First call I was on hold for over eight minutes. Hung up and called back, the woman who answered asked to put me on hold again. I said that I had been waiting and no one picked up. She gave the excuse of them being busy, offered no apology and continued to insist to put me on hold.  The length of time she spent arguing with me she could have just taken my order. I said forget it and hung up. My husband decided to call and try his luck (I am currently pregnant and my sweet husband wanted to make sure my craving was fulfilled). He was able to place our order with another gentleman who answered pretty painlessly. He got clucks and fries and I got the french dip sandwich which we were told would be ready in 15 to 20 minutes. Went to pick up our order (arrived 25 minutes after placing the order) and was directed to the bar. With one bartender making drinks she was also required to handle the to go orders and package them herself. After waiting 10 more minutes our food was brought to us. Order was correct but I received a laughable amount of au jus sauce. Asked the bartender for a bit more and she got an attitude. Acted like she was majorly inconvenienced by my request for more. We got home and began to eat, our food was what we wanted but again we were disappointed in the serving size of their "bottomless" fries.  Again, a laughable amount.  It seems like their work flow and management needs to be revised and some more training on how to delegate and handle the tasks to be accomplished.  From here on out we will be avoiding this place like the plague.

To start with the fries were lukewarm and seemed like they were rewarmed from the other day,  they don't even give you very many maybe 8. The grilled chicken burger I got tasted like rubber it was so disgusting and it had grit in it I couldn't even eat it very disappointing place.

Got seated at a soaking wet table. Seats were wet as well. Had to get napkins to wipe it down myself. After getting seated for 10 mins, still no one to take our drink order. Another table was complaining that they been waiting for an hour for their food. Walked out and went to Charley's instead. Bad customer service for sure.

What a joke this is for what a restaurant should be.  And in the last few months it has gotten worse.  Let me explain. Went there the other night with my neighbor.  He ordered a burger and complained that it was overcooked.  Which I could see that it was and it looked terribly dry, which he also said it was.  I mentioned it to the waitress who served us and once she sensed my disappointment she avoided our table.  I was able to eat my meal while my friend waited for his to be cooked again.  I tried to get the attention of the waitress but she acted like we had the plague.  I ended up going over to where they were cooking and could see the manager standing there waiting for the burger to be prepared.  Finally he comes out with the burger.  I had also wanted a refill of my drink and more fries.  Again the waitress avoided our table.  When the manager passed by I asked him and he seemed to not care and tried to avoid our table. Overall the food was disappointing, but the service was even worse. The last two times I went here the service sucked and I think I know the problem.  The servers who are mostly younger women think they deserve a big tip for what I see as mediocre service at best.  As for the food I have noticed the prices have gone up and the portion sizes have gone down.   The combination of both the above is a recipe for another restaurant closing .  I just don't see this place surviving in the long run.

Ever since the new management took over right before the remodel this place has been a joke. He'll give you his submissive schpiel when your food is 20 minutes late for takeout and try to kiss your ass but I'm 5 times in with terrible service, my last being a sit in where my waitress blamed everyone but herself for it taking 30 minutes for me to get a beer while forgetting various other things. Used to be my favorite dine in burger joint to a place I'll never go to again. Make the trip to Vacaville instead and that's my recommendation without even going there, this location is that bad. Update- Got food poisoning with my last trip and found out the hard way this morning.

I wish I could leave zero stars. Service was good. Food was disgusting. I thought maybe I just didn't order the right thing? Wrong. My husbands food was just as bad. The people sitting at the booth behind us were also disturbed by their food and sent it back telling the waiter "it does not taste right". The waiter tried to make it up to them but they refused anymore food. I could go on forever about the fruit salad. Do not order it. It's some very sub par canned fruit and sliced apples. I've got a picture of it.  All in all if you're contemplating going here, seriously don't bother. It is a pretty bad disappointment. I will stick to Fuddruckers.

I was contacted by Katie with a generic message saying how they missed the mark this time. No Katie from the looks of the reviews since my last one, you all have missed the mark with everyone. I don't know what has changed at this location but what use to be an awesome establishment has now turned into a place that neither I nor a whole slew of people around town will never return to. Who is running this place? He or she needs to look at all the business that they are losing due to this new renovated restaurant being consistently filthy, cold food, dry drink glasses, crappy servers and just down right a hot ass mess. It's been 3 months and I still refuse to go back & whenever someone suggest this place, I raise hell and say no way. WHAT THE HELL HAPPENED??!

I really love Red Robin but they need to tighten up the execution of the food orders. I'm giving them 2 stars because our waitress Angela was great and she pulled up my rewards account for me so that I can use my email coupon. I'm beginning to think the cooks can't read. I go to three other locations (Vacaville, Concord, and Pleasanton)and this location is the worst of them all. The food never comes out right. It never fails. Today, even the machine that takes your payment wasn't even working. Now, the waiters are not the problem but then by the time they come back to make your order right, your food has gotten even colder (and it's not like the food is hot in the first place). It seems like the helpers never come back when you ask them for something. Because the things you ask for when you order never come the first time. And it can be difficult getting help when your waitress is busy. Today, there was a strawberry in my water. I ordered a BBQ burger, they didn't put BBQ sauce on the burger, I ordered a salad with my burger, they brought out fries. So irritating. I hope this review reaches someone in power that can change this. Serving burgers shouldn't be this hard to do.

Remarkably terrible service. I don't think I've had worse service ANYWHERE.  Our waitress was VERY rude, never looked at us, was very inattentive, never cracked a smile and the food took forever to get. We live in Napa so Red Robin is kind of a treat for us, but we will DEFINITELY take our business (which is frequent) to Santa Rosa or Vacaville instead.

Red Robin would have definitely received a 4 stars, if only the service was better.  Location: It's in a great location, inside of the mall. The New look they did to the red ribon looks amazing: inside and out! Bar area, looks really nice as well as the nice cushion the seats had to them. Big Flat Screens everywhere throughout the restaurant.  Food: The food was good, the mozzarella sticks aren't the best. But when I ordered the BBQ whisky BBQ it was delicious. The fries are still bottomless, but you can't order them before you food gets to the table.  Service: Service was pretty bad, the lady rarely came to our table to check on how we were doing. The table needed to be picked up from old dishes and they were just sitting....sitting...and sitting! I would ask for more water, she would walk before I could even ask for something else in need for!  In overall service is what made it lose their 4 star and 3 stars because of how they turned the place around

Took is 20 mind to be seated before we actually just went and seated in the bar since NO ONE BOTHERED TO HELP US NOR SEAT US! Sat down and took another 17 mind for a waiter to come and that's because we called him over. (Yes I'm timing everything) finally he took our order.. it has now been 32 mind and STILL NO FOOD!!! I'M BEYOND IRRITATED!

Tried to get a table yesterday but because we had a two year old and a stroller we didn't want to sit smack dab in the middle of the restaurant. So we waited for a booth...and we waited...and waited, we could see open booths but we continued to wait...and wait. After 20 minutes of being told to wait 5 more minutes we left and went upstairs to Applebees where we were seated immediately. Terrible, last few times we've gone there I've noticed that the service is slow. The time it takes to be greeted or even acknowledged is way too long. We saw a young couple leave because no one acknowledged them.

I came here one time with my girlfriend & were sat before we tried to catch a movie , it took literally almost 20 minutes before the server came over to take our drink order. And we were ready by then so we ordered as well. Drinks didn't arrive until entrees were at the table. Mind you my burger was not what I had even ordered , it was supposed to have the fried jalapeños on it , the server said oh I'll be right back with some so you can add it on. Where we were sitting there is glass where you can see the expo line & literally watched the server drop them all over the expo line scoop them back up with her hands and bring them to me & acted like I didn't see her doing so. So by this time I asked for a manager and walked out because it seemed like the manager didn't even care! So we tried to come a second time only because my girlfriend wanted to again before a movie , and we literally waited at the front to be seated for about a good 30 mins. Nobody was even at the stand to greet us. One girl came walking up still didn't greet us and walked off. Another family was waiting and you can see how irritated they were as well about it. So we just walked out. And will never be returning again.

I really love Red Robin. It's my favorite burger place to go to, just not this Red Robin. I've been here a couple of times in the past five years and the quality and customer service seem to be declining quite rapidly.  I'm usually not one to complain so I gave this Red Robin a couple of chances but maybe I shouldn't have. There were a couple of encounters where I asked for sweet potato fries instead of steak fries but always ended up getting steak fries.  Every time I've been here, service has been really slow and it looks like the waiters don't know what they're doing. There were even times we had to remind our servers that we've been waiting to order after maybe 30 minutes and once we finally ordered it took another 45 minutes to get our food. My sister had to remind a server we were waiting a while for our food and it had actually been sitting out the whole time. The last time I went here, I was with my boyfriend and another party of two were seated before us. Once we were finally seated, our servers never got to us. I heard the people on the left and right of us complaining about everything. While waiting, I decided to look at the yelp reviews and saw someone got food poisoning from this place.  I've never left a place before ordering but I guess there's a first time for everything. My boyfriend said we should just leave after he remembered he got food poisoning from this place a while back so we got up and left.

Not a fan. Our waitress was okay but she didn't seem all that interested in serving us (I don't remember her name). My friend and I ordered the spinach and artichoke dip, and when we got it, it was only a little warm, like it had been sitting there for a long time waiting to go out. Two pieces of wilted celery sat on the plate, with bunch of overly greasy chips. There was barely any dip given compared to all the chips that you were served. The actual burgers we ordered were decent, my friend seemed to enjoy hers, and her sweet potato fries. I got a turkey burger that fell apart by the time I had eaten half of it. One other thing I really feel the need to add is that I got really sick the next day. Horrible stomach virus/food poisoning. The overall atmosphere of this place was kinda dark and wasn't very impressive. Won't be returning, unfortunately.
My kids love the food, and they have a good food selection for adults. The game app thing they have entertains my kids while they wait for food. The staff is always sweet and service is great.

Just lousy service and a major let down. I refrained from going there for about six months. Went back and it has not changed. Anything i tried to order they were out of it, the coffee machine was broken or they did not have the particular bread to eat with the sandwich i liked. Too, it was not particularly busy the time of day we went and it took almost five minutes to have us seated. I am not a fan any more. Goodbye RR.

This place is HORRIBLE.   Service was painfully slow. It actually took a full 30 minutes to get our drinks.  First the server forgot to even ring them in, then she came back to tell us they were out of the wine I ordered, so I chose something else to drink.   We watched the drinks get made and then the bartender sat them down on the service bar and went back to standing around doing nothing.   Our table was about 10 feet from the bar.  She saw us.  She knew they were our drinks.   She didn't give a shit.   I was just about to get up and grab them myself when the waitress came out of hiding and picked them up.     The food took forever and came out wrong. My boyfriends BACON burger came out cold, overcooked....
