Oh and without bacon.   And the fries (all four or five of them) tasted about a week old.   My salad was missing the bread, which I had to ask for, and when I finally got it, it was so hard I could have used it as a doorstop.   The absolute best part of this phenomenal experience were the lazy bitchy girls behind the bar.  They did nothing but talk shit about customers very loudly.    All the while every other table around us was dirty and had been dirty for over half an hour.    (See awesome not-so-incognito photos I took).  Get off your lazy asses and do something!!    Worst service, horrible food, filthy tables/environment, laziest, bitchiest bartenders I've ever seen in my life.   Which is saying a lot considering I've been a bartender for 18 years and I've pretty much seen it all.  Just AWFUL.

Usually I wouldn't give a low rating to Red Robin but the service at this location wasn't good. They took a long time to seat us when the restaurant had more staff than customers. The booth we were assigned was wet, had a sweaty smell to it and it took around 5 minutes for a server to be assigned to us. I can understand if a restaurant is crowded and it takes time for a server to be assigned but it doesn't make sense when the restaurant is mostly empty. To the servers credit, she was mostly prompt with the service and hence I settled for this rating. As far as the food goes, the food wasn't bad but I have had better at other Red Robin locations.
Slow service. It's not even busy. Over cooked burgers and slow to refill drinks. It's more about the service than the food quality. I can't imagine this place when it's busy.

Red Robin had messaged me personally about the bad experience I shared here and they invited me to come back at their expense. First of all, I'd like to thank them for caring and reaching out. I really didn't expect all that so good job there guys. To be fair I really took the time to give RR another chance so I've been back twice, once on a weekday and again on a busy Sunday.  Both times I had the same waitress and I must say she is one of the best I've had at RR, her name is Esperanza. She really hustles and makes sure you're enjoying your visit.  On the weekday, we went in for lunch and it wasn't too busy. Drink refills were adequate and we requested fries to come before the meal so we could have something to snack while waiting for the entree. The food came out fast so we didn't have to wait.  Big plus there. We also had several fries refills no prob.  On the weekend, ordered the same meal but with broccoli this time. We got a bowl of broccoli early and fast. AND It was piping hot! THIS is the RR I expect. Thank you lunch staff and Esperanza. It did get very busy there afterward and the kitchen unfortunately got backed up. We only got 1 broccoli refill and it didn't arrive until we were full.  Esperanza did what she could and was very honest and apologetic so I appreciate that.  To fix this, I think the kitchen may need to make more of the refill items available for the servers to fill.  Also for peak hours perhaps have more staff.  The new men's room layout is amazing. It finally makes sense in there. And it smelled nice. So far A+ for the renovation.  With a good server and a little patience, you can still enjoy and get your Red Robin fix.  But weekdays have much better service over weekends.  I still got a little irked by one of the intense waitresses but it looks like she works hard as well. She may need some training in caring about all patrons as valued guests and not as in-laws. Thank you RR. I know you guys strive for excellence.  You guys did good enough and I enjoyed both visits.  But pls pls get your refill game on point.

I should have read the reviews before going here.  We ended up here by default. We first went to Buffalo Wild Wings, we left after 15min of sitting and no site of the waitress. So we ended up walking over to this place. When we walked in i told the host that i hope this place isnt like Buffalo Wild Wings. She said , "oh no not here we are slow so we will be fast". They sat us down and what happened,  NO waitress for 15-20 min. We were hungry so stayed.  Service was horrible, staff just talking about there daily issues, etc...

This rating is mostly directed toward the Manager that was on the floor but clearly didn't feel like all of the customers were important. My husband and I wanted to take our 3yr old out for lunch after having a nice time at a near by pumpkin patch. Since we are Red Robin Royalty card members we thought we would stop at this Red Robin and have a nice lunch. We were seated right away and they didn't appear to be too busy, so I was shocked when we just kept being passed by and ignored. We waited 15min before getting up to explain the girl up front that we have been sitting for 15 min and no one has even come by to say "Hi". She told my husband that she would get someone to come help us right away. Another group that was seated next to us, having the same issue, was at least told by the manager who working the floor that he would have someone right with them....and then just passed us by. We waited a little longer and as it become evident that no one intended to come help us we got up and left (as did the group having the same problem). The best part of it all was as we were leaving we looked back through the "Patio" seating and saw the Manager who had ignored us clearing our lemurs off the table and acting like he was the hurt party in all this.  I have had mostly bad experiences at the Red Robin as of the past year. While I have had a few good experiences (all of which have been in the evening), they unfortunately do not out weigh the bad. I will make sure to advise all my friend and family that this Red Robin really does not care about serving their customers and that they may want to rethink were they want to eat.

Not happy Well I order Togo I got nachos and 2 burgers and when I got home I got nachos without cheese smh then both the burgers came with about 5 fries in each smh looks like I won't be eating  there anymore

So I came here with my cousins a week ago, we waited like 40 mins for our food, it was cold and unsatisfying. I was very disappointed that we waited that long when there was only like at least 15 people in the whole resteraunt. The food was dry and my cousin had to eat his wings with a knife because the server didn't give us silverware. The garlic break I was promised on the menu was literally the shape of a kruton. I will never go to this place ever again. I recommend that you never visit this location ever again.

We liked our waitress. When she was at the table she was pleasant, but she wasn't available much. It took a very long time for our food to come out. Our drinks weren't refilled. The restaurant was FILTHY and the bathrooms were some of the grossest I've ever seen. The food just didn't taste good at all. This location used to be great. We won't be coming back anymore.

This is one of the worst Red Robin's I have been to. And everything has to do with customer service. This is my third time coming to this location and I have concluded that it has pretty bad service. I thought the first two times were just off days, but coming on a Wednesday afternoon where it has less people and is less busy and to receive the same service as when it is actually busy is terrible. We didn't received our drinks till 10-15 min later, the staff was not attentive, tables were not cleaned at all, and if we didn't sit in the bar area we would have been waiting for seats (which there was plenty of) 15 to 20 min later. Then we had to wait 20 more minutes for our food, no one offered refills, and saw so many customers being neglected. This place is completely under staffed and is not managed correctly. I've got better treatment at Applebee's than this place. It's a shame to, because I like Red Robin's food, but I know to never get it from this location.

Don't even bother here. They won't seat you. And if you seat yourself, that just makes them upset I guess. Waited 10min to get seated, nothing. Sat myself down, nothing. Even after a good half hour. Ended up walking out and going to AppleBees where I was given immediate service and the waitress very attentive.

Asked for my "bottomless fries" before my burger and they said they no longer give them to you untill you get your food. So i guess thats not bottomless then.... very disappointed the fries are my favorite thing at red robin

Visited tonight with the hubby. We entered via the parking lot entrance as two employees exited from a side door conducting a nosy profanity-laced conversation including the F word. Walked inside to find more dirty tables than clean. There were literally more dirty tables than tables with diners. When we told the hostess we wanted to sit in the bar, she handed us our menus and said we could find our way. When we arrived at the bar we were seated at a table that had not been wiped off. When my husband asked the bartender to wipe the table he got some attitude going, grabbed a rag, made a swipe at the table and left us to sit on the last patron's crumbs...next to a dirty dish-covered table to our left that was never bussed during our entire meal. The table of four seated to our right had to reorder missing food items more than once, and due to a lack of attention had to get out of their seats to locate a server for help to rectify their multiple food issues. We began with iced tea and the pretzel bite appetizer, obviously deep-fried, over done on one side and undercooked on the other, with runny lumpy cold cheese sauce for dipping. I ordered the chicken caesar wrap with a cup of clam chowder. The wrap was executed without garnish but otherwise perfect. The soup was served at room temperature and sent back. In addition, the soup was not served in a cup but instead served in a vessel the size of a ranch dressing side. Hubby ordered a cheeseburger which he said was okay, came with bottomless fries. He wasn't offered additional fries until we were finished with our meal. We were never offered iced tea refills. As we were leaving Hubby mentioned to the bartender there were ten dirty tables just in our area. The bartender glanced around and said "yeah that's about right." Hubby asked if they had a busser and was told they did, but the bartender had no idea where he was. Next time Hubby wants a good burger we'll need to find a cleaner establishment to visit. Sorry Red Robin, you lost customers tonight.

The waitress was great continued through the meal to check and see if we needed anything.  My food came very quick and was cooked just like I asked. I have no complaints and the environment was very peaceful for lunch time. I was surprised how quiet and calm the place was. It was a great experience  I will continue to go back.

You might as well drive the extra 15 minutes to go to the Red Robin in Vacaville. The service here is the worst. It took an hour for our food. We asked for a refill for our bottomless fries, and half an hour later, the waitress never brought us our fries. The waitress never bothered to refill our waters either until we finally asked at the end of our meal. All the waiters/waitresses intentionally ignored eye contact with us to avoid providing service. Just like how management seems to intentionally ignore all these reviews to improve their establishment.

Very very disappointed!!! Not at all impressed with the new Look.. when we arrived there was no host in sight, I can see if they were busy but they weren't.  Seating area is to cramped together luckily we had no one next to us.  2 starts was for our waiter after all she was nice despite the food not being all that great and on top of everything my order was dropped so had to wait even longer to supposedly RE MAKE IT !!!!! Yeah not sure if I believe that.  But here goes to the the entire work force of Red Robins: BATHROOM AREA WAS WAS SO DISGUSTING Unfortunately I didn't have my phone on me to take a picture on how bad it was. I don't understand why they let it get so DISGUSTING . Yes I know its customers who make that way and then agin shame on those who don't clean after them self. Simple things like flushing the dam toilet or paper towels in trash instead all over the bathroom. No toilet paper in holder no hand soap it was just all bad.  Don't recommend this place rather have In & Out!! Cheaper and taste way better.

This location sucks. I called maybe 3 times within 15-20 mins to inquire on a pick up order. I was put on hold each time and no one returned to take my order. Good food but this location sucks. There is always a problem with orders, or not getting service. I prefer the one in Vacaville. I never had a problem with my orders and or calling to pick up at the Vacaville location. Fairfield location sucks.

I sat at the bar hoping to grab a drink and a quick meal. The bartender wasn't around when I sat but figured I'd give it a few minutes. A server walked past me to deliver food to the only other customers in the bar area. She walked back up to the POS terminal and another coworker, who looked like she was getting off, walked up to talk to her. Still... No acknowledgment of my existence and it had been 4 - 5 minutes at this point.  I finally asked if there was a bartender working. She said yes and that she would get her. She continued to enter on the terminal, checked on her table again and then walked away. By this time it had been about 7-8 minutes that I'd been sitting at the bar waiting. I was so turned off by the complete lack of customer service I decided to walk out. A sorry and a water would have helped the situation.  As soon as I asked if I could speak to a manager, the bartender walked past me quickly followed by a couple of other staff members giving me a smirk. I decided there was probably no point in letting the manager in on my frustration. The company culture staff project is typically a direct result in management style. I won't be spending my money here. Too bad for the bartender. I spent a lot of years serving and bartending... You missed out on a good tip.

I was hoping to get a table and no hostess was around to check for us. So I slipped into the bar area and the were some empty tables and open chairs at the bar. But those space had dirty dishes and glasses and no one visibly there actively cleaning up. I stood there hoping to get someone's attention but no one seemed to care. Not wasting my time there anymore. This place used to be friendly and clean

I was not going to make a review but after two visits and two bad experiences, here it is. A couple of months ago my husband and I experienced a meal where there were little black gnats flying all around the table and landing in our food and drinks. The server and manager apologized and said they were having a problem with pest control in the mall and were trying to have it remedied. They comped our meal and were very apologetic. We were pretty grossed out though and didn't really want to eat our food.  We just went back with two of our kids yesterday. They are remodeling and it seemed that the gnat problem was remedied. Nope. It was better but they were not gone. We had a few flying around at our table. My clucks and fries were cold, my lettuce under my fries was brown, my son's meal was cold and there was a long brown hair on his fries. YUCK!  When the waitress came to refill my drink she asked if everything was good and I said no, I don't think she expected that answer because she took a double take. I showed her the hair. She picked it up with a napkin and left and then the manager came. Of course she apologized about the gnats which they still are trying to remedy with the mall pest control. The hair she said was unacceptable. The took off my son's and my meal from the bill.  Unfortunately, I like Red Robbin's food but I'm not going back .

What in the world has this place turned into? I used to love coming here, but after the remodel, it's been nothing but crap.  My boyfriend and I walk up and tell them the 2 of us will be eating. The host says "Dining room or cocktail area? The cocktail area is much quicker". Of course we choose the cocktail area.  It went down hill from there. Our waitress is horrible. Maybe she had a bad day? I'm not sure.  Our order was messed up, our drinks were messed up, our time here was bad. I'm not coming back. Sorry, but I'm not sorry.

Its ironic that with the renovations to give this place a new feel, they'd change the fry oil so it wouldn't have a rancid and bitter after taste once you eat anything fried.  My 9yo son, Da Kidd, wouldn't eat the mozerella cheese sticks because of it.  I could taste it in the fries unfortunately.  Just gross.  I, overall, was not impressed, not even the least bit.  My "prime rib" french dip sucked.  No flavor, the bread wasn't toasted....my husband ate his burger, mainly because he was hungry and was more than half way done with it by the time he received his Blue Moon....that we ordered before we got our appetizers.  Da Kidd was happy with his Mac & Cheese and Root beer float.  I geuss we won't return. I can think of 5 different places I'd rather spend our hard earned payola!  Good luck....maybe it was a fluke.  I'll never know.

This is the worst Red Robin experience I ever had. We got seated right away at a dirty table. It was bussed and we finally got our menus. It took almost an hour for the food to come out. The food was obviously sitting under a heat lamp for a while. The ciabatta roll was soaked with olive oil and ruined the specialty sandwich. My hamburger, which I requested to be medium rare was actually burned and well done, not to mention the soggy bun from siting too long. The french fries were cold and they looked like only half order each, just old fries tossed in our plates. Don't they make gourmet hamburgers here?  The waitress was always in a rush and never checked on us while we were there to give us fresh water. This is a Red Robin to avoid.

Stopped to celebrate my husbands b-day for a lunch and drink. Now I understand that this location is being remodeled and all but does the service have to suck as well? So we sit at the bar and the lady asked us what would like to drink? I ordered two beers and a shot. She said ok, poured the beers and then disappeared. I mean she never came back! So as I'm looking around her co-worker approaches and ask if she could help. I re-ordered my shot and asked where was the original bartender in which she replied. I don't know, I think she forgot about you and went to run food. Alrighty then. So after it seemed like forever she shows back up and asked if we were ready to order. We placed the order and she turned to us as she was typing in the order and laughed. She mentioned something about her log in number and that the system didn't recognize her. She walked off and I assumed she went to take care of whatever was going on with her log in and still place our order. Well I must say we sat for about and half hour not including the time we had already been there. The guy sitting in the back of us came in after we sat down as well as others and they all received their food! Ok something is very wrong here. She delivered her food to other tables but ours was no where to be seen. She even came back into the bar joking and laughing, but with no food and explanation why? Just as we started to get a manager and cancel the order, she finally brought our food which was unsatisfactory. My fries were ice cold and my husbands chicken was cold and his salad looked pitiful and thrown together. I also want to point out that he asked if he could have his chicken grilled to which he got a no response. Now I have worked in the same industry for years and have been told by many managers that if we have the ingredients to make what the guest request, then we do it. I can't believe that Red Robin has to just fry everything and can't put chicken on the grill instead. Needless to say we refused the food and she removed it from our bill, but I have to say that if I were her. Because it was her fault all the way and I told her as much. She simply forgot to put our order in the computer and instead of making it right by apologizing and possibly getting the manager involved. She thought by bringing us cold, dry food to two "drunk" people at the bar that it was going to fly pass us. We only had 1 beer and I had the shot. I would have comped the entire bill and or offered fresh food or something. We will not be returning and to think I had never been to a Red Robin before and now that I have had such crappy service, I won't give it another shot!

Another disappointing visit. I'd hoped that the remodel would've brought along better service, but I was terribly mistaken.  The two stars are strictly for the food, which was really the only pleasant part of the experience.  When we came in we waited for a few minutes for a host to seat us. Our server, Sarah, seemed like she would rather be anywhere else in the world, other than here. There was no offer to refill empty fries, and we only received drink refills after having to ask (I guess the empty glass at the edge of the table wasn't obvious enough).  Red Robin Solano, please get your stuff together.

What Red Robin doesn't serve fries when you're waiting for your food?! Service was friendly but slower than molasses on a freezing cold winters day on Lake Placed in the month of January. Our burger was WAY overcooked and could've doubled as a frisbee. This place sucks a large one, and we won't be returning.. unless we're desperate like we were today.

Red Robin has gone down after the years. The food is still good but the service and the service to get your food is slower than usual. I almost wait 45 minutes for my food every time now. The appetizers aren't as good as they sound so don't let that fool you. I've always been a fan of red robin but I won't be going back anytime soon.

We waited ten minutes for someone to seat us. A waiter came by and told us he'd get someone. A hostess came by five minutes later and told us she'd check if there was a table available. We were then abandoned for another fifteen minutes. pls why.

This is the 4th time in a row we have been here and NO ONE has taken our order...so far it has been 20 minutes and counting... The food is always good but their serving crew is following some kind of un-evolved, inefficient routine. If you come for the food, Great...if you come here and are in a hurry...keep going!!

The food was good, but the service was sloooow.  There was about 20 customers on the floor but the food took over a half hour to get.  Either the kitchen was on break or there was only one food preparer.    I don't plan on returning soon...

Got there and waited about 5 minutes for a host/hostess to appear. When one finally did show,  no one had kept track of which guest was next and my family and I were almost seated in front of a family who'd been waiting for a lot longer than us. Then, when we were seated, it took 20 MINUTES for someone to come and take our drink order (after I went and grabbed someone). I provided both our drink orders and our food orders (cause who knew how long it would be before we could get someone back over). When our food FINALLY arrived, we had no silverware and no napkins and had to wait to grab someone to get some. We then had to wait to ask someone to get some to-go boxes, and then wait even longer to get them. My daughter's endless fries ended with the first batch. This was overall THEE worst visit to Red Robin Ive ever experienced. It felt as if they would just rather have us leave than provide us with service. I will NEVER go back.

Haven't been here in a long minute. Usually LOVE this place, and they even remodeled since the last time I've been there.  This specific event though, lol .. I'm dying.  We get seated (my son and I) and gave our ordered, which to me .. was super simple Shroom Burger  Fries Freckled Lemonade Mac and Cheese Fruit Strawberry Smoothie Well what had happened was .. our waitress ended up cutting her finger righter after she took our order, and well was dealing with that 30-45 after she took our order, still no food.  Everyone else, including the peeps that came after us had their food.  I made a kind of smart remark to a waitress passing by under my breath and the hostess kept looking at our empty table and finally someone came over.  She told us what happened, felt bad, but it was already late and I wanted to just pay for the drinks and leave.  Couple minutes later my son's food finally came out and 10 minutes after that my food came out. My meal was on the house and the waitress ended up coming by, she was okay too.  Glad everyone was happy at the end. Would I go back? Heck yes . . Red Robin .. yummmmm!

An okay burger at a decent price. I've visited this Red Robin many times and the service and food have been hit or miss.  In regards to the food, they tend to load the burgers with mayo, BBQ sauce, or whatever sauce you get which makes them slippery and falls apart easily. Tip: Ask to have it cut the burger in half. It doesn't fall apart as easily. In my experience the fries have never been great. They're either soggy or not very hot. I like my fries crispy and warm thank you very much. As far as taste, it'll hit the spot if you're really craving a burger, just don't expect anything spectacular. The service is just okay. The waiters don't really seem to want to be there. This isn't related to the service, but the last time I was there the forks and knives were really gross and needed to be cleaned again. So I suggest you check those before using them. I'm giving this place 2 stars mainly because I think that the service is subpar , but I would rate the food a solid 3 stars.

I would leave a review for their service, but after waiting for 20 minutes and nobody even greeted us or even came up to us to see if we were being helped and to top it off it wasn't even busy. Bad experience

Picked up takeout and the food was fine but the customer service was horrific. If Nizelle can't treat customers and her coworkers with some respect then she needs to go home. Her attitude was insufferable. Hope she gets reported to her manager.  She needs a day off and come back with a different attitude on another day.  We didn't get our food for 45 minutes but it was right when they opened so I'm sure they needed to ramp up.  Updated my review because a member of Red Robin sent me a very nice message. I'm sure Nizelle will be talked to and will no longer be treating customers and her coworkers with such disrespect. The takeout food was packaged very well. The order was 100% correct and tasted delicious.

Warm cocktails , Half the nachos had nothing on them, the grease piled in a lake under the chips. Seriously? How do you screw up nachos? The buffalo wings were salty and hard. Slow,slow service. This Red Robin is a mess of sadness combined with the crappy feeling you get when you have wasted your money. Be warned and read the other reviews.........
Terrible service. I will never take my family to this restaurant. The tables around our table remained filthy the entire time. Our food was served warm.  I had no choice but to put one star.

I've come to red robin many of times my waiter was always great! I feel terrible for the employees...I've seen and heard the way management have spoken to them in front of guests it's ridiculous I will not return because of that
cold food garbage servers and worst managers I wish this place would get replaced with something good I recommend the food court.

This place is consistent frustrating! The service at the bar is very slow because the bartender has duties elsewhere. The food comes out COLD 75% of the time. The bartender/server rarely checks to see how your order is or if you'd like a refill on those endless fries or your empty glass. BAD corporate management design is responsible for what should be a much better restaurant experience.

Waited 10min. For the waitress to notice we have called to be served. She brought us utensils with napkins when the table next to us was served with utensils and napkins in a red tray. The drink came out and she finger wiped the outside of  the drink. She explained why she brought cold sweet potato fries then asked if she will bring more garlic fries for my daughter. First of all, she shouldn't have brought cold fries then she brought more fresh fried sweet potato fries when she said she will bring more garlic fires. Overall, this was my first visit to this chain of company and this will be my last, it was terrible all around .

So it's been awhile since I ate here and they've redone the place. But...the food wasn't so great nor the service! It was seriously ridiculous! Burger was dry. Fries way undercooked! Maybe I chose a bad day to go!
I would give them 0 stars if I could. Horrible service. Waited over 20 min just to be seated then another 10 while being ignore.  Finally left without ever having seen the server.

Yikes!  Love their concept and product but this store consistently misses that mark.  Servers can't keep up with sections with too many tables. The last two meals took 20 minutes from order to delivery (burgers, nothing fancy).  The $5 root beer float arrived half full and the burgers had a tough edge crust that was really bad.  Well try again in a year or wait until they're under new management.

Absolute worst service I've ever received in a restaurant my life. A painful experience from the moment I walked in the door. First we waited 8 minutes to even be acknowledged much less the extra 10 minutes to be seated to a dirty table in a nearly empty restaurant.  After being seated my and my nephew waited 10 minutes to have our dirty table cleaned and then an extra 15 minutes to have our order taken. (Nearly in an empty environment mind you.) I ordered a $13 dollar burger. Nothing special just well done with cheddar cheese. My nephew ordered spaghetti with shrimp. He asked the waitress if it could be made al dente. The waitress promptly looked at my nephew as if he had two heads. After taking the time to explain to the waitress what cooking something al dente means, I went ahead and ordered a beer.  My beer arrived almost 20 minutes later room temp and almost flat. My 24 year old nephew asked if he could take a sip and of course I obliged. Another waiter saw what happened while cleaning up someone else's dirty table that another customer had already sat down at. Immediately stopped and took a B-line to our table and grabbed my beer that I ordered and very rudely scolded us telling us that she will not have minors drinking in her restaurant, and will no longer serve alcohol at our table. After my nephew went to his car and another 15 minutes gone by without so much as being asked for a different drink, he showed the licence to the manager, got into a small tiff with her and was actually YELLED at by a female member of management. Needless to say we will never be visiting this establishment again.

Gotta say our experience at the Red Robin in Fairfield, Ca was a shear nightmare. What could go wrong did go wrong. Everything from waiting a lengthy amount of time for our meals to the waitress losing our food ticket. It took more than an hour to eat our meals. It wasn't the least bit crowded so that isn't any excuse for the poor service, quality of food and lack of concern. I spoke to the GM and he invited us back to his restaurant but I highly doubt I'll ever visit any Red Robin again. Just a bad experience all aroound!!

I always enjoy red robin and the food is usually always great. Today I decided to call for pick up and decided to eat in because there's no where to sit in my work place and not one person offered me water or something to drink. The food was soggy (I ordered Clucks and fries), I got there at my pick up order time. I always appreciate any kind of service because I work in the food industry and I know it can be "tough" but no one literally offered me water? That's like basics. So for the customer service I give a 2, I appreciate my food being done on time but it also seemed like it was sitting for like half in hour when really it was "10 minutes." Oh and I tipped them after everything

I really hate to give such a low rating, but it is deserved. I would think that during the holiday season, and on a weekend, you would know to be fully staffed. Our server was very sweet and doing the best that she could. The kitchen was running so slow it was horrible. We waited almost 50 minutes for our food to arrive. We are rewards members and have been loyal to Red Robin for many years. We were celebrating my daughter's 10th birthday and this is where she wanted to go. I mentioned our celebration to our server who put in an order for a Birthday sundae. Thirty minutes later, it never arrived. Customarily you receive one and they sing to you. This did not happen either. I mentioned my complaints to the manage as we left. She seemed unconcerned and gave us 2 coupons for a free appetizer. I will not be returning to use these. We finally left with a disappointed Birthday Girl!!!  Very, very sad!!!!!

First and last time here. Don't know where to even start.  We went here for a quick dinner before heading home (our 6 month old was being babysat) and wanted to get in and out and get going.  We were seated just as the 49ers game started. Left at halftime, and that's only because we flagged the waitress down for our bill (and gave her our card). Since when does a burger and a chicken wrap take more than half an hour to make? We were at the point if the food wasn't coming within 5 minutes we were leaving. Place was grimy. My seat cushion was so badly torn I sunk into a rip about a foot in length. Table was sticky as well.  Food was average in taste, but also cold. My wife's fries container was so small I didn't even know it was her 'bottomless' fries. They screwed up my cold burger but I picked things off because I didn't want to wait for a new one. Also, for the portions size, quality of service and environment, this place is an absolute rip off with their pricing.  I should've looked at reviews of this place before going. Literally have not one positive thing to say about this place.
Today for the first time I left red robin unsatisfied. Our waitress Rachel took ten minutes before even greeting us. 20 minutes in with no drink order placed, I left.

Attempted to eat here tonight.  First we waited for several minutes at the hostess booth before someone finally appeared.  She grabbed two menus, told us to follow her, threw them on the table and walked off.  No greeting, no smile, no communication at all.  We started to sit down but noticed there was something smeared all over the booth seat, so we sat at the next booth over.  The seat was clean, but the table definitely was not. We looked around.  The floor was truly filthy.  The empty tables around us were piled with dirty dishes; one had an overflowing bussing tub sitting on it.  To be clear, they were not at all busy; there were many more empty tables than not. We sat for awhile.  No one came with water or offered us drinks.  We continued to look around, and decided to leave.  The whole place was just filthy; we decided we didn't want to know how dirty the kitchen must be and that this was not somewhere we wanted to chance eating.   We ate somewhere else.  Two hours later we walked by Red Robin on our way to the car.  The dirty dishes were still sitting on the tables and the dirty, filled to overflowing bus tub still sat there.  If I could give a no star rating, I would.

The food was good but the service wasn't good at all. Felt bad for the server. She was in a section all by herself serving like ten tables. So everything was very slow. Luckily we we're seated next to a tv so we could watch the Warriors and rockets play. Don't think I'll be going back to the mall location again anytime soon unless it's just for the bar. If that!

I am elated that Red Robin reached out to me, with an apology and a gift card. If I was rating the company as a whole, I would certainly give them five stars, but this location has some work to do to improve their food and their service.  Regardless, I still love Red Robin, and I'll be back. :)

Sat there with my wife and daughter for 30 minutes the my order was taken. After 20 minutes my cold order of onion ring arrived with no water. Waited another 10 minutes and my baby got fussy so I decided to fuck this place and leave and never come back to such a BS restaurant.

What the hell has red robjn turned into?  First of all avoid those Ziosk things on your table.  My six year old saw it and immediately pressed some apps and there was a 1.99 entertainment fee.  Then at the end of the meal they made us pay via the Ziosk.  It wouldn't take our gift card and then we had to call over the waitress and manager for them to apply the gift card.  Then they came back and made us pay via the ziosk again.  Why make it so much harder and make guests self checkout at a full service restaurant?? This is worse service than McDonalds.  i am never going back until they dump all these ziosk things.

location: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: Red robin isn't what it used to be. My sister used to work here and the service was fast, personable, and friendly. I haven't been here in maybe 4 years and it's horrible. Our server took about 10 minutes to get our drink orders, and it took 40 minutes to get out two burgers. And within all that time he only checked up on us once to see if we were doing ok. Won't come back here again.

I only gave this place because I love to eat here. Love the fries, and sandwich menu. Still in the process of remodeling. Love the wall art. Please clean the floors, bathrooms and seats regularly. The service is so so,  it's a hit or miss.

DO NOT eat here!  ...unless you're desperately starving.  My Bleu Ribbon hamburger was served to me burned, dry, and room temperature.  My soda was flat.  French fries were so-so and could tell they had been cooked at different times then thrown together on the same plate.  This all occurring approximately 30-45 minutes after placing our order in an otherwise well-staffed restaurant with moderate customer traffic.   Huge disappointment eating here and surprised we didn't get sick.  Such a shame too since hamburgers are what this company prides themselves on.  Hopefully management from the corporate level takes interest in these recurring unsatisfactory reviews and implements much needed changes at the Red Robin location on 1350 Travis Blvd. Fairfield, CA 94533.

Went there today for a quick lunch. We were the first ones there right at 11.  We sat there while other customers came in, ate and left.   The waitress Savannah never came back by to tell us what was going on with our meal ( customer service was horrible). The waitress had attitude finally when the she drops off the food we have to flag her down for some mustard, the burger wasn't cooked right.  We asked for well done. It was more like medium rare.  We had to flag her down for the check and then again for our change.  If you ever go there avoid her section. She has attitude and zero customer service skills.  One of the other waitress apologized saying she was new. No excuse!!!

The service my family received in three different occasions, was horrible! We waited soooo long for our server, food, drinks and check. Two different servers actually helped us more (once we flagged them down) then our section server. Mediocre food too...

Just right off the bat, the following are the things I like about this place: decent service, bottomless fries, that tower of onion rings though, and the Irish milkshake. Those things aside, this is another one of your run of the mill diners that I only seem to hit up when I'm the mall with a large amount of friends. Out there, you've got the king of chain diners, the one and only Denny's. At the bottom of the barrel, you've got Applebees... ugh, I feel my stomach turning already, just mentioning that place. Then you've places like Red Robin's. Also a diner, but they seem to have a particular specialty in the area of burgers. Crack open their menu and you'll find a bevy of all sorts of burgers. I've had a couple of burgers here. While nicely sized, they never seem to come out just right. They always tend to come out on the dry side. I've ordered medium rare and I once even attempted rare... but alas, the end result was the same. Burger tasted alright though, and no ill effects on my digestive system, so that's always a plus. Like I mentioned at the onset, there's a few things I like about this place. Though on somewhat of a downside, they a little on the slow side when it comes to the bottomless fries. Still, gotta love that tower of onion rings and that Irish milkshake. I guess if I ever had to choose between this or Denny's... I might still end up at Denny's for nostaglia's sake. That being said, Red Robin is an alright choice. Just... you know... never settle for Applebees. And I'm out.
Had really good service. Jessica's constantly checked on us!! Had an amazing birthday shoutout to my boyfriend for his 21st!!

Came for a healthy dinner option while watching the game, was delightfully surprised! Ordered the turkey burger wrapped in lettuce with bottomless steamed broccoli, fancy that! Couldn't get much healthier! If you're cutting calories they really make it easy here. Friendly waitress also took back my burger when it came out sauced in aoili  (which I had asked to hold). Brought it back LOADED with extra lettuce, tomotoes, onions and PICKLES. And let me tell you..that was a DAMN good turkey burger, WOW! Maybe the best I've ever had. SO plump and juicy. Whenever I make them at home they're so dry! I must know their secret. And they kept the broccoli flowing. Overall I couldn't have asked for a better week night alternative to cooking a healthy meal myself, definitely a fantastic option.

I've been visiting this location since it's opened and always loved the service and food until the last year or two service has gone down significantly the quality of food is obvious the chef doesn't care for the presentation, the meat doesn't even taste like it used too. Staff seem to be going thru the motion of serving but customer care is missing, they lack the sense of being proud of where they work. I've thought maybe it was the time and day of visit but I've gone in on slow times and everything is the same.  It's a shame i won't be collecting my free birthday burger because it's not even worth my time or taste buds.  sorry red Robin and staff... but somethings got to change

I was told about a new burger they had so I decided to give it a try. The lady who seated us was clearly not happy. She said someone would be right with us. 15 minutes later, I wasn't even looked at. All I got was a glass of water. Not even any French fries. So I asked the lady who seated us if we were going to be waited on and she walked away and never saw her after that. So, after about 5 minutes more, I just told them to cancel my order. The service there is the worst! The employees at the bar area seem to not like their jobs very much. Listening to them talk to each other was a dead giveaway. Shouldn't air out resteraunt business around customers. Not very professional. Will not be going back to this location.

Food was ok once it was hot, first try not so much. Our waiter tried to hold it together but the staff in the kitchen was just not working with the poor guy. Food, meh. Service Extremely DISAPPOINTED.

WORST Red Robin I've ever been too. Not only did our waiter take our order but he came back and took it again because he " couldn't read his own writing ". They got our whole order wrong. Manager didn't even apologize - I'd never go back here.

Worst experience I have ever had at a restaurant. Our table was completely ignored for 15 minutes. Finally asked for a server to come over. Server took order, brought us water and then we waited 30 minutes for food. Then the server came back over and took our order again... There was a "mix up with the tickets" waited another 15 minutes... Nothing. We were at this place for an hour and got a glass of water. Worst. Service. Ever.

Good: order and food was pretty quick. Burger was good. Bad: 1st beer was flat as hell..... as in absolutely no carbonation..... There's a Budweiser factory 2 miles away, this shouldn't ever happen. 2nd beer(different type) showed up after I finished my meal And I ordered it 30 minutes prior......thanks here's 7 more bucks for a beer I don't want. Lastly my wife's chicken wings looked like they ordered them from wing stop, had them delivered, put them in a warmer for 30 minutes and then brought them out. Overall red robin sucked a** this time and we won't be back.The only good part was the first 10 minute we were there the other 50 SUCKED!

Horrible service it gets 1 Star  Manager tells me they lost our ticket for our food. Our waitress never said a word to us. After about an hour later manager comes to our table and says sorry we lost your ticket food then comes 20 mins later. My angus burger I ordered came to me with no mayo fries were lukewarm. The manager tells us as we leave he had all his cooks quit on him tonight. Pretty sad. At least he comp'd our meal. Needs some quality cooks there. Red Robin is now hiring calling out all cooks in Fairfield CA Solano County

The (stupid) hostess in the front told me and my family it would be 10-15 minutes before we would be seated. So we waited. 30 minutes later she said she didn't know how much longer it would be. No estimate.. Nothing! Mind you, several other people were seated before us  when they came after. What a waste of time! What's even worse is that the "manager" came out and said he didn't know how much longer it would take. Who the hell knows??? Poor customer service. So we left and went to fuddruckers.
Fuck this place. The manager and front desk morons don't know shit. Waited for 30 min then they said we gotta wait another 30 min. No time management. !

I am disappointed coming here with my family. Not because of the food but because the service is very slow. Just to be seated alone, it was 15 minutes wait before the hostess showed up to let us know she'll be right up with us. Then when we were seated and ordered our drinks and food, our drinks didn't come until I complained that we've been waiting 20 minutes and more. The manager finally just came and brought our drinks. It's unfortunate that we have this experience. They should have more people working specially on a busy nights such as weekends. Other than that, the food was good.

If I could give 0 stars I would, no one was there to seat us when we arrived, it took a while to get our drinks and the cups were filthy, all of the wait staff acted like chickens with their heads cut off, and the food was cold and only half of my wrap had chicken, the other half was just lettuce and bbq sauce. We won't be returning to this location, never experienced service like this at any red robin. So disappointing.

The food is great but the service and time it takes for the food to come out unbelievably slow.  Took 15min to order and took another 25min for the food to come out.  The manager hardly spoke to the guests, instead he delivered food and walked away.  What happened to "do you need anything else?"

My friends and I went there for lunch today with my friends today and the service was terrible. They didn't let us get kids meals even though we had just ordered some a couple months ago. Also they didn't even come to ask us what we wanted to order until I finally yelled at them. Then our drinks came super late, once we were almost done with our meal and our server ended up laughing at us. Then this other lady ended up complaining to the manager and he didn't even do anything about it and she said she was not coming back and I don't think I am either.

Had a bad experience here about a year ago. Decided to try it again for my kids birthday...what a mistake. The food is outrageously priced for what is served not to mention the service is a nightmare! Our waitress (Hailey) was horribly rude! She was such a nightmare the manager took $50 off the bill and gave me a $25 gift card. I'll NEVER return to the mall location. Need stronger management there!

They paid less attention to me this time than the last time i went in. So the $10 discount card this time was a waste of time. Just do not go to this place. Going out of business is what it needs!!  horrible service!!

Worst overall service I have received in a long time. We were seated in the bar area. They got my order wrong (garlic herb fries, instead they only gave me regular steak fries) and they never fixed it even after I let them know, so after 10-15 minutes I just ate what was in front of me because I was tired of waiting. The garlic herb fries never did come out at all, even though it was still listed on the receipt. Also, they did not give us napkins with our meal. Our waitress never checked on us after she took our order. Food taste was average, not worth all the hassle invocled with this establishment. We are never coming back here again.
The worst service I've had in a really long time. The waitress forgot to put in one of our orders and didn't even apologize. Would not come back again.

We really like this place, but the service is really hit or miss.  First off, they need a full time person behind the bar.  The phone rings constantly with no one to answer which can be very irritating to listen to.  The food often comes up cold as well.  They appear to be short handed at times.  Maybe this is because the employees seem to engage in too much chit-chat with each other. We were never offered a refill on our drinks or the "bottomless" fries.  On the flip side, We love the fact that a gluten free bun option is offered and for that and the varied burger menu, we will continue to return.

So here's the deal..... I ordered a 16 dollar burger and asked for buffalo sauce on the side. After i placed the entire cup of what I thought may have been hot sauce...turned out to be marinara. Plus they never refilled our drinks. I left with an over priced burger that tasted like a meatloaf doused with ragu between a ciabatta roll. Far from yumm.

I always come here hoping that the last time was just a fluke.  Of all the times I've been, the last was the worst. I ordered a plain chicken burger for myself. Plain. It's the easiest thing to make...literally just the chicken and the bun. Simple, right? First it comes out with mayonnaise on it then the replacement comes out RAW.  To top it off they charged me for three burgers; the one with mayo, the raw burger and the finally-correct-one. And for a coffee I ordered but never got.  I'll just stick to Applebee's right up stairs.
Discussing, I will never come here again. I saw 2 small roaches on the table. Tried to find a manager but no one was insight or an employee. STAY AWAY FROM HERE. They lost my bussiness!!

A friend and I went to Red Robin for my birthday dinner.  We waited about fifteen minutes to be seated (lots of empty tables, and room at the bar), finally got our table and our server tried to rush us in to ordering. After looking at the menu a while, I decided on the guacamole burger, asked for my bacon to be cooked on the grill and crispy.  When the burger arrived, it was lukewarm at best, the bacon was clearly microwaved and not crispy, there was no guacamole on the burger, and our server didn't come back for twenty minutes.   My friend ordered the burger with an egg on it, pure grease dripped down their hands upon taking the first bite.  Once again, no server for twenty minutes.  We ate what we could and left the rest!  The best part about our visit were the fries ...  I don't plan on going back. UPDATE 11/18/2013 Katie has contacted me via email here a few times and tried to appease a dissatisfied customer, however, after giving my telephone number and returning the call three times to the kitchen manager to no avail, I've contacted Katie and let her know I appreciate that as the owner she did reach out to me, but won't be returning it's quite a drive from where I live.  I'm sure it was just a bad day and I wish them continued success.

Any possibility NO STARS can be given? Well..let's just say we had a party of 4..were seated at 8:55pm (yes just less than an hour ago) our server was non-existent after she brought us our iced teas where i think she poured a whole bottle of peach syrup and raspberry syrup in our iced teas. NEVER EVER checked on us as we waited for our food, btw our order wasn't complicated. ..our order consisted of a milk shake, chicken wings (from the appetizer side) and a hamburger. We got tired of waiting and decided to go upstairs to Applebee's. I wanted to walk out not pay for the drinks but chose to pay for them instead. .by the way, our server decided to tell us that our food wasn't ready so that was the reason why she never checked on us. NO APOLOGIES  NOTHING, didn't comp our drinks...NOTHING. NADA. ZILCH Hey red robin..THERE'S A REASON WHY YOUR YELP RATINGS ARE SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO LOW....maybe upper  management should check out the reviews... NEVER EVER COMING BACK. YA'LL SUCK!

I've always loved Red Robin and the last time I came to this location I told myself never again. However yesterday I gave them the benefit of doubt and decided to try them out again. Well another bad experience. We were sat quickly and the hostess was nice everything after that was a total fail. We waited about 15 minutes before our waitress even greeted us or even took a drink order. After that it took about another 15 minutes for our drinks, since my drink came from the bar I had to wait longer. Finally, our drinks came and our order was placed. Do you know it literally took 1 hour for our food to come out and when it came out the plates were hotter than the fucking food. But before all of this our waitress comes over and tells us OMG the kitchen scared me and she repeated our orders and my daughter ordered a burger and she said I know I put that order in I just wanted to make sure I wasn't missing anything .... girrrrrrrrl.... we didn't even wait for the bill just paid the bill on the tablet they had on the table and was on our way... CUSTOMER SERVICE SUCKED even the damn bus boy seemed liked he didn't like his job throwing the damn plates, silverware and cups in the bin like he was pissed at the world. One star goes to the hostess and the manager that kept coming around asking if we were ok, we just said yes so we didn't have to deal with shit. The whole time we were there we probably saw our waitress 3 times which were drink order, food order and made sure we paid the bill.. NEVER AGAIN AND WOULDN'T recommend to NO ONE !!

Walked in- no person greeted us- had to wait for seating, dirty plate, cold fries, dirty bathroom, slow service. Our waitress was awesome so it wasn't her fault. She was friendly and gave us extra crispy hot fries after the cold ones. Come on Red Robin- you can do better than that.

They recently revamped the restaurant and bar area, also some changes to the menu. I thought maybe that would correlate with the service here. I was very wrong. Food might be good, but service is horrible every time we come here. It doesn't matter the time, seating location, server, we always seem to wait so long for our waiter/waitress to come back to the table. They always ruin our orders too, isn't that what the pen and paper is for? Come on people. Today we came in and it took 25 min for them to bring us utensils and water. Definitely not coming back here...

Took forever just to get our drinks... We ordered water.   Taking forever to get our food. Got here at 12:45p and its 1:35p still haven't received our food.... Unbelievable! We finally got our food but one of our guys we sat with didn't get his food and then they brought him the wrong food it was just a horrible experience I would avoid this place like the plague

I am not sure if its just me, or if the whole service industry is having a real rough time providing decent service . This is the third place within about a two week period I have got up and left. The bartender, and the waiter, for our area, never even looked at our table. I gave them one last chance to look at us as they came by to acknowledge us and it didn't happen so we got up and walked out. They were not even filled to quarter capacity. This is usually an indication a very bad management but unfortunately for them, it falls on the servers.

Can I seriously rate negative stars cause one is just not even close to what this place has come to. Renovation yea it's nice .... Experience worst one ever we, waited 20min before even being offered drinks (I would have left but BF insisted we stay) once those came another 20 min for our order to be taken (mind you I'm pregnant and have no patience for this) we are told the kitchen was behind 20min so we placed our order anyways cause well BF wanted to wait. Waiters were looking like they were confused we had the wrong order brought to us twice our appetizer came 30min later and we are still here waiting for our food to come in I'm guessing another 30-45min.
If I could give negative stars I would... Do not go on a Saturday night.  Super slow, Understaffed, burgers waaaay underdone.

My daughter and I went to Red Robin on Valentine's Day. First off, the remodeling that they did, makes it impossible for the hosts to see people waiting to be seated on BOTH sides. We and about 3 other parties waited for about 10 min before somebody came to the front to seat us.. And it wasn't even the host, it was a Server named Angela who was so super sweet and very apologetic. Angela did her best to get us all seated and even brought us our drinks even though she wasn't the server in our section :) It took our real server about 15 min to even come to our table. She looked frazzled and overwhelmed (which it wasn't really that busy). Not sure if she was new or just having a bad night. We ordered our appetizer (Double Cheese Sticks) and food at the same time ( the machine on our table wasn't working). We waited about 30 min for our appetizer than 2 min later our food came out. We were not able to enjoy our appetizer as we didn't want our food to get cold. It was not a great experience on Valentine's Day for us. But luckily my daughter and I can make the best out of any situation

I'm giving two stars simply because MY food was great. I came with a large group of about 10-12 and everyone was less than impressed with the service. I don't recall our servers name, but she was unprofessional, to say the least. Drinks were forgotten, we got two half full baskets of fries for the whole table, then had to ask for more... Twice. She was sarcastic, and not in a fun way, making a lot of uncomfortable comments the entire time. My first drink, which was the exact same order as my second drink, was completely different the first go around. Did we have a bartender shift change in there somewhere? Everyone left less than impressed and would not recommend this place to anyone traveling through the area. Again, two stars because the black and bleu was perf. Take that out of the equation and you have one big, hungry, irritated group of people that brings us down to one star. Sorry guys. Work on it, would ya?
Wow this was a cold burger, and cold unlimited fries, really better off at fast food...  The fricking fork had a booger on it!!!  If I could put zero star I would!!!

I appreciate the remodel but I guess they didn't remodel their staff........... Or maybe their place is just slow in general. Every time I come they take forever for everything. Took a long time to get seated, forever to order, and I'm assuming it will take forever to get our food. The guy who looks like he is the manager does not have food customer service skills. Will give it 2 starts and not 1 because there have been once or twice when I came and the food was good. Also don't like that when we are getting seated, us as customers can see the inside of the kitchen.

The place looks good but the service and food was horrible. The french onion soup was so over cooked it was mush. We asked 3 times to get one refill. The server mishele was not very friendly at all. The place was not busy at all. We did not even get a refill on the fries after asking. I finally said check please. I just wanted out of that place. I will never eat there again.

Terrible service even worst burger. The only good thing was the fries. And extremely overpriced. I will never ever frequent a red robin chain again. I knew I shoulda have went to fuddruckers across the street but I just didn't wanna leave the mall. I guess that's what you get eating at the mall.

Went to this establishment to bid farewell to a coworker. Server was awesome however something must be said about the food. I ordered a Cesar salad for lunch and my check was brought before I even got my food. The other problem with my salad was the lettuce was dry and nasty. In addition the salad came with chicken and the chicken was raw.  Nothing was done and paid for food which was disgusting

Service was rushed, restaurant was dirty and in disarray, server spilled water on one of the member of our party, they brought out 3 meals on 12 different plates, the proportions were screwed up, and they brought us a roll of foil for our "to go box".  WTF!  I AM NEVER EATING HERE AGAIN!
I can't say service is bad cause no one took our order, so we hop out don't want to wait 30 minutes to take our order

Was in town for work and was excited to try Red Robin. I'd seen lots of ads on TV but had never been to one. This specific location had an average burger and rotten service. We ordered three burgers and sodas and it took over an hour to get out of there.

BEWARE, DONT WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY HERE. I would give zero stars if possible. We went there to eat before going to the movie. We sat there for 15 minutes with no one bringing our drinks, letting us know they'd be with us, NOTHING and there were open tables everywhere, not like they were busy. So I asked the hostess if I could speak to a manager, and they said he'd be right with me. We waited and he never showed up. Finally about 30 minutes later a waitress showed up and took our order. We waited another 5 minutes and still no drinks. We wasted 35 minutes there with little to no service. We walked out. I doubt they noticed or cared. WORST SERVICE EVER!!! Spend your time and money anywhere else but here. I'll never go there again.

First time coming to this location and their customer service is not good at all. Slow service since I first walked through the front door. There was no host at the front and had to wait along with other customers. Once I was seated I had to wait again just for the waiter to take my order and took even longer for our food to come out. The simpliest thing like a milkshake I order didnt get to my table until maybe 15 minutes. My waiter did not provide any napkins and utensil for our food. Waiting and waiting still no one coming by so I had to walked up to asked someone. By far this is the worst experience I've had anywhere. Looking around most waiters are working slow compare to the amount of customers they have. These workers need to speed up and check on their tables more often or they need to hire more people working every day. This is a spot located inside the mall and they should expect a decent amount of customers walking in on a daily basis. Food taste decent but customer service need to be worked on. Not only the service was very very poor they also need to maintance the women's restroom. It smelled bad and is definately in need of air vent or a freshener.  I do not recommend going to this location and rather go a different location or another restaurant.

This place is just sad and dirty. Our water had a bunch of floating pieces in it and utensils had crusted on food. I was about to barf when i saw a dried on piece of lettuce stuck on our fork plus little bits of food on our knives. Yikes. We ordered the onion tower, no plates were given. We had to eat our food on top of napkins. Server walked by like that was no big deal. The burgers themselves were okay. Fries were on the skimpy side. I wanted to ask for more fries since they always advertise them as bottomless, but I just wanted to get outta there as soon as possible. Didn't really have much service either. The cherry on top of this crummy and dirty experience was our server asking us to fill out a survey at the end, give her good reviews or else she'll get written up and lose her job. It just got really awkward after that. Once she left, we just payed on the tablet and bolted outta there as soon as we could. Did not fill out the survey either. I don't want to lie that service was good or participate in this dysfunctional practice. DEFINITELY will not be coming back.

Service is horrible . Took like 30 min just to get the table served there drinks . And my mom asked for water with no ice twice and after waiting forever the waiter bring water with ice . We were a table of 10 and you would think service would be better since the waiter is most like going to get a nice tip but no horrible service . Pretty said since it used to be better ever since there remodel service is horrible.

Terrible. Party of six, restaurant relatively empty. Horrendously slow service,  appetizers and entrees came out simultaneously. While staff was friendly,  without fail,  everybody's food came out cold and burnt. While I'm not a huge fan of this chain admittedly, this one is simply terrible. One would be well advised to eat anywhere else.

1st time we walked out of a REALLY SLOW SERVICE! We usually have tons of patience but in this case we have child with us and we asked if we could at least get something for our kid... Like fries! We didn't get anything!  We end up going to CHICK -FIL- A!

Walk in at opening for and order I called ahead to place and the bartender who would be taking care of my order gives attaitude. Does not say would you like something to drink while you wait does not print a copy of what I ordered to verify it. She just says "well it is not up yet" and walks away and helps the other guests and just begins ignoring me not ok. Did not seem friendly until she was taking my money. I have been treated better at McDonald's don't think I will ever be coming back.

Food is alright, nothing to brag about.. But the service at this Fairfield location is SHITTY!! I don't know who the hell runs a restaurant this way! Server dropped our food off and never saw her again. Had to ask the manager for my check. Mind you, my table was her only active table.. There was maybe 4 other families eating at the time.. Clearly in a different section! Awful!! NEVER AGAIN!!

My wife, son and I went to Red Robin for their burgers and fries and was very disappointed. First, out of 3 place settings, one knife and 2 forks were dirty.  I don't mean inspect with a magnifying glass dirty, but very obvious dirty.  They were replaced when they brought our soft drinks. Second, after drinking about 1/3 of her soft drink, I could see garbage in her glass.  No, not back wash, and we hadn't received our food as yet.  It was replaced. Third, when our burgers and fries arrived, the fries were a mix of medium hot and warm fries.  It was as if they put hot fries over leftover fries and served them after a 10 min wait. Forth, and the final, two of the burgers that were ordered "Well Done" came out Medium, and the one burger that was ordered "Medium Well" came out medium rare, with emphasis on the rare, cool, middle of the burger. The server was apologetic and offered to fix the burgers.  No thanks.  The manager came over to apologize and took one burger off the ticket.  My son and I ate our burgers, my wife couldn't eat hers at all and wouldn't take a replacement meal from ANY restaurant, let alone one that has shown this type of food preparation. They are in the midst of a remodel job and are still open for business.  I can't see how that should affect their food quality.

Where to start... 1. Fries tasted stale. 2. Been to fresher red robbins that actually toasted buns; nope, nothing gormet about these burgers. 3-5. Ordered peach tea and tasted like old strong fermented syrup. Husband strongly agreed, thought had alcohol in it - he's usually the one who lets things go but was the one that really did not want me to drink and ask for a new one. I asked if i could change my drink for orange cream soda. Waitress took full cup away. Received cherry cream soda. I apologized for seeming difficult and reminded waitress of drink i ordered and she brought the right one but was clear as day half carbonated (half drink orange soda, half non flavored carbonation). To add insult to injury i was charged for the untouched peach tea. I gave them 2 stars bc the cherry cream soda was good.

My favorite burger place. I've never has a burger that I didn't like. The fish and chips are great too. My grandmother from England could eat the fish and chips daily. It's her favorite place to get them.  Oh, and the drink menu! Alcoholic or not, thwy have a large, fun menu always full of suprises!!

I give up on this place; it's just been consistently bad every time I've gone lately. Most recently, I asked for a booth and was seated near the bar- which was fine. The server that was helping me seemed distracted, which isn't the worse part. She brought out an appetizer but no utensils, and when the food was brought out, told me that I would need to wait for any sauce to go with the fries. I thought they were suppose to ask you that before hand but whatever.  Now.. On to the worse part. I understand fully well that fruit flies are common around a bar (wine, sweet drinks); unfortunately red robin does not have this under control. When a bug inevitably landed in my sauce, I calmly pointed it out to the waitress and politely asked for a replacement. Throughout the time I was eating, I was waving my hand to keep the little bugs away. Instead of apologizing or offering to give me another seat, the server simply agreed about the bugs and never checked on me or refilled my water again. As a result, I ended up paying electronically and leaving. I completely understand that they are a busy restaurant but I've received consistently crappy service so many times from them that this review just had to be written. Good luck to anyone that eats here and if red robin management is reading this; please train your employees a little more or lighten the load for them.

The best thing about this place is the bottomless fries and bottomless root beer floats. The burgers are overpriced and lack luster. You are actually paying for the bottomless fries because the burgers are not very good. The people cooking never seem to get what "medium cooked" means! I always tell them that I would like medium rare, but no blood. I want it pink! It always comes out being overcooked, more "well done" here at Red Robin. I stopped saying anything about it and just dealt with it. I always say I won't come back, but my friend always drags me back here whenever we go to this mall. Uuugh!'He and his chain restaurant fetish! This place is a pretty cool place for a group of friends to hang out, but if your looking for a great tasting burger, I would suggest some other options!
Shitty service won't ever go to this one again nasty bathrooms and non professional workers it's a job not a playground

I ate here with my family last Saturday. It was my sisters 7th birthday. They love going to red robin USUALLY. The only reason I'm even giving stars is for the manager who went out of his way for us and the host who did everything she could to accommodate us. We had trouble getting a table, but it wasn't the hosts fault it was another host who sat people who had just walked up at the table the original host was saving for us. We waited a total of 25 minutes. The manager came out and gave us a free appetizer and gave us an awesome huge booth. I mentioned once to the host it was my sisters birthday and once to the manager,  Our server was nonexistent. We finally finished paid and left on the way out the manager asked if they sang happy birthday to her. I told them no they didn't and I don't even know who our server was. Three different people came to our table for drinks to drop off the food and then to drop the bill. We were HALFWAY down the mall when the manager ran up behind us and gave us a gift card for our bad experience and I just thought that was the sweetest thing. Not the gift card but the fact he didn't give up on us because we walked out the door he chased us down! That's an awesome manager!! I wish I remembered his name but I hope giving the date will help. :) I think it was Saturday April 5th

I always like red-robin. They're great for a lunch while we're at the mall. 100 times better than Applebee's upstairs (really who still eats there?). The food is always hot and fresh, they never charge us for extra sauces, and their bottomless fries are great for the table.  I joined their rewards program and it has paid off more than once. My birthday reward is right around the corner :)

I know Red Robins or any restaurant chain like this could be slow at times however I would assume that phone orders would move at a considerable rate. It took me 25 minutes to finally get my order of onion rings for to go. I'm not sure why I was patient enough to wait so long but I did. I called and was immediately put on hold for 10 minutes. I hung up and tried calling again however no one answered so I keep calling and same thing, no response. When I finally got ahold of them they put my on hold again and I didn't even have a chance to say anything. When I finally got off hold the man on the phone told me he's going to put me on hold but I cut him off and said I'm not going to be on hold anymore and if he can just take my order now. I was just upset that I was being passed around playing phone tag just for some onion rings! He took my order and that was that but what made me mad was there was no one in the restaurant so why was I being on hold?? I only know this because I work in the mall and my coworker passed by the place when she was picking up her food from Buffalo Wild Wings and she told me that there was no one in there. What I don't get is how your phone service could be so bad? Imagine how they are in the actual restaurant! I'm definitely never going to order here again, worst customer service ever.

We went there on January 1 @ 1:00 to celebrate my grand-daughters 21 birthday. We had a party of 6 and a small baby. We sat for quite awhile before my daughter's soup came out and the baby was crying because she was hungry. Service was very slow, so if you want fast service don't come here. When we finally got our food, it was good except the fries were only warm when they came out. Once we got our food, the waitress came by to check if everything was good, after that she never came back. I wanted more fries since you are suppose to get bottomless fries. After a long while, I finally press the call waitress button on the kiosk. We waited 15+ minutes and she never came by. I finally flagged, I think a manager and he got us the fries we wanted which were hot. Never again will I go back to this Red Robin. I have gone to Red Robin many times all over northern California including this one and never have gotten such bad service. Like Aaron's review, I also think this restaurant needs better management. Upper management needs to read all of these bad reviews in a short time period and make some changes!!!!!!!!!

Visited on a Wednesday evening.  I am a repeat customer. However, the service staff were more interested in their socialization sitting around us than customer service. They may have all been on a break, just seemed odd.  Our milkshakes came out when we were nearly finished with our meal and our food was cold.  They had several disagreements regarding sections covered and shifts while we were eating and listening .

First of all the wait was 10-15 minutes when we went in, we didn't get seated till a good 30-40 minutes later. We ordered right away and they got our drink orders wrong and my milkshake was half full, then we proceeded to wait about 45 minutes for three burgers and fries with the waitress coming by every 10 minutes saying our food will be out in just a moment! Finally the food came and since we've gone here for several years we thought the food would be the saving grace to the horrible first hour. My mom and I both got the new crab cake burger and I would not recommend it at all! The crab meat was so ground up it was like someone chewed then made a patty out of it. Also the water I asked for had stuff floating in it so I didn't even drink it. In the end my dad tipped but doesn't even know why he did because of the horrible service and food! Also while we were waiting a clearly mentally challenged young man was lost and the manager I'm assuming was not being nice at all in the way he was talking to him to get him to sit down.

Food and service moderate. Neither order was correct but didn't need to be sent back. I highly recommend NOT ordering 16oz Stella draft. The glass and fill was less than the 16 oz Sierra Nevada and cost more. The server that brought out our food was the best part of the evening. The self check out generated a blank receipt so we had to ask for another one. After dining at Nine Bark its hard experiencing service like this

We went to red robin, our waitress was La La she was so wonderful, she was working soo hard, but she was by herself, she had 9 tables, it was quite ridiculous. Management should be ashamed of themselves for making this young lady work so hard. I could not believe this. This is how you loose good workers. I truly hope that she finds a better employer, if I had my business cards on me I would have given her one and hired her on the spot, this young lady truly cared and should not be abused in this way, shame on you Red Robin. You suck!!!

The absolute worst service I've ever had here. We've been here for an hour and have seen our waitress "Shantel" once. The manager himself is horrible as well. Every time we needed something I had to get up to find someone who would swear they would find someone else and then 29 minutes later someone would show up. Its such a mess in here. DO NOT GO HERE!!!! The burgers are good but not good enough to sit through this horrible service. There is plenty of good food in this area..... DON'T DO IT!!!!!
All of the staff were very friendly and helpful! I also had gluten free fries that were made fresh in new batches.

My family had not been to this restaurant in a couple of years, so I thought it might be a nice change. This location is currently undergoing renovations, not a big deal. My issues had to do with the food quality. I was shocked when my daughter's meal was brought out. She ordered the clucks and shrimp. This $13 meal consisted of 2 small chicken strips and 4 shrimp. Is this really the norm? My bacon guacamole burger was basic, nothing to praise. About 30 minutes after we left, I was rushing to the restroom. 9 hours later, I am finally starting to feel better with a tender tummy. Never again.

This place SUCKS Walk in from the parking lot side and view 2 tables taken and ALL other tables dirty and stacked full of dishes.
