We waited for a booth maybe 5 minutes cause the hostess just had to ask the bus boy to clean a table, cause clearly he was so busy cleaning off the other tables (sarcasm). Waited probably 20 minutes for someone to simply come to our table. I ordered a bailey's shake, side of mac n cheese and a short stack of onion rings. My husband ordered Buffalo wings, chicken salad, and a stella from the tap. Buffalo wings were so gross.. bailey's shake was a vanilla shake, literally.. Stella was stale, tasted like a beer you've opened and left in the fridge over night. Food took forever, drinks took even longer and they were the last thing brought to the table.. the manager apologized for the drinks taking so long and that we didn't like the wings so they took off the wings and my husband's salad from the ticket. Great, cool, but I honestly didn't care about how much it was going to cost, I just wanted to eat decent food and not stare at a load of dirty dishes . By the way all the dirty tables were still dirty when we left. You need to fire your bus boy that was working new years eve and train your servers to at least pre-buss their tables I saw the two servers working on the mall side cleaning their tables but the side I was on was filthy.. I understand being short staffed but the amount of dirty tables I saw was completely unacceptable. I feel bad for the people who work here and actually do their job right cause the rest of them are making people like me never come here again

The hostess did a Very poor job attending to potential customers. She saw a long line forming and didn't even bother to acknowledge the long wait, didn't acknowledge the customers, tell us how long the wait would be, ask other parties the number in their group, maybe put names on a wait list? etc.  My husband and I waited close to 25 mins and only 2 parties ahead of us were seated. We eventually left. Note to Managemet- maybe train your Hostess staff properly...and maybe you'll get customers to come and rate your place better.

Please do not waste your time here. Because that is exactly what you will be doing. Wasting time standing at the hostess station, wasting time choosing something yummy to eat, wasting time watching your food sit at the pass waiting to be brought to your table. We ordered onion rings, three entrees and a kids meal. Not one thing was warm, except my daughter's fruit cup. Ew. Our waitress seemed busy, but was pleasant. The hostess was not busy or pleasant. Seemed as though she could have welcomed us warmly, into a not incredibly busy restaurant. Final thoughts: Icky food Somewhat indifferent wait staff Poor cleanliness. (The sugar packet holder was caked in pretty old looking campfire sauce.) Will not return, ever.

Service was great! The bartenders were all cute and Nicole i think her name was suggested a Sam Adams October lager that hit the spot. I got the guacamole bacon burger and i thought it was ok. Carl's Jr's version is better imo. But the onion rings were smackin'!

I've never written a review before, good or bad but my experience at this place caused me to download the yelp app just so I could. The only good thing about this place was the manager working tonight,if it wasn't for him I'm not sure if we would of had anything to eat or drink tonight. It started with the being on a wait list to be seated,I understand it was busy that wasn't the problem. People coming in after us and being seated before us was (we were both parties of 4). It only got worse from there. We were at the table for 30minutes before my son got his apple juice (my daughter didn't get hers,we delt with it and shared between the two) After an hour my kids food came and my daughters order was wrong. She is 8 months old,and can't eat just anything so we had to send it back. We waited over an hour for my daughters and my food. By this time she ate (drank) apple juice for dinner,my son was tired of waiting, and my husband was pissed off. The manager was the one who brought our drinks and took my individual order since our waitress never really came back. So much for a nice family dinner out. We will not be back.

Came in and was greeted by sam. She asked if i was a rewards card member and when i said i was she informed me my order would be 50% off. If she didnt tell me i would not have known so i appreciated that.
Unlimited fries bro...lol...unlimited fries bro...

I am here on Veterans Day. Appreciating the effort to honor us veterans....they least they could do is try...the free burger is one of the worst I have tasted...the service is non existent.  I waited 45 minutes for a cold burger and forts that were not cooked properly. I asked for silverware and never got it. Sorry Red Robin you definitely missed honoring veterans today. Won't be back...

A friend and I decided to grab a bite to eat here earlier this week (on a weekday). We've been here several times in the past with no big problems; however, there was a bunch of stuff that irked me this particular night that we went. First and foremost, the hostess saw that I'm using crutches and that I have a walking boot on, but when it came time for her to lead us to our table, she basically took off so it was hard for me to keep up with her. Luckily my friend asked her to slow up and pointed towards me. She stopped so I could catch up, but she didn't apologize or anything, just smiled. That was the first thing that rubbed me the wrong way about that night. Our waitress came by quickly to ask us what we wanted to drink; however, it took her FOREVER to come back and take our orders! The place was NOT packed, so I felt like there was no logical reason for the service to be so damn slow!  My friend & I both ordered garlic fries, but when out meal was brought out to us, our fries looked completely different. Usually it comes with garlic (duh), shredded cheese, and parsley (I believe). His had everything on it and mine just looked like they quickly threw on garlic on it before it was brought out to me. I usually don't nit pick at stuff, but for some reason that bothered me but I couldn't complain because the waitress disappeared once again. She was nowhere to be found until she saw that our fries were low, when we were almost done with our burgers. As if our dining experience couldn't get any worse, when she brought our refill of fries, she pretty much just threw them on the table and immediately walked to the people sitting at the table behind us (they were waiting such a long time that they just told her that they weren't going to eat there). The only time she was attentive to us was when it came time to pay. I was already out of water long before I finished my burger, but since she dropped the bill off and since I was still somewhat picking at fries, that's when she wanted to give me a refill on my water. I'm honestly very disappointed with my latest experience at this Red Robin location. There weren't a lot of guest dining here, yet the service was slow as hell! On top of that, I felt like the hostess was rude and inconsiderate when she clearly saw that I'm temporarily disabled. It just makes me wonder what the hell does she do when there are people with permanent disabilities. The waitress was slow, not really attentive to us, and I felt like she was rude since she threw our fries at us. I definitely won't be returning to this Red Robin anytime soon.

Almost  every time that my boyfriend and I go to red robin we are very disappointed. We went in yesterday to give them one more chance, and again we were let down. He specifically asked for no mayo on his burger and for it to be rare, it came completely burnt and with mayo, I asked for mine the same way and it also had mayo and was burnt. He also ordered a root beer float that when it finally got to our table the root beer was warm and flat when we told our waitress she of course apologized although we never got a new one until we were ready to leave. The manager was very understanding and apologetic but needless to say we will NOT be going back there again

If I could give negative stars I would. Went in with friends. Was seated and no one came back for another fifteen minutes which is when they asked if we wanted water. After actually getting our water our orders were taken.  We waited more than thirty minutes and when our food came out orders were wrong. We ate and while eating no one came to see if we needed anything, we were out of water from our FIRST drink for about twenty minutes. We sat while our waitress continually went past us without looking at us or asking if we needed anything. Asked her to speak to the manager and she never even brought him to us so we had to get him ourselves. Told him about our service and all he had to say was sorry continually and that he would get our tickets. Took him thirty minutes to do that. Other tables were complaining for poor service and wrong orders. Terrible place. I have never complained but the best option for this restaurant to get any better is to close down.

This place only receives a four star rating because I know a few awesome people that work here and they are awesome servers (that in itself receives a star)! Other than that, I rate the place a three.  I will usually order any of these items and be content with my selection: caesar's chicken wrap, royal red robin burger (medium-well), clam chowder, fries/garlic fries (bottomless as well), mighty caesar salad with chicken.  The food is pricey, but what do you expect for going to a restaurant that serves burgers? It isn't Jack in the Box.  The freckled lemonade is to DIE FOR! I absolutely LOVE this stuff. Refills are FREE!

I see now that I'm not crazy! So many others are having the same experience!  My sons and I have been coming to this RR for several years, at least a couple times a month or more. During the past few months the quality of the food and the service there has gone downhill FAST. It used to be great??? I'm confused. I will mention only our last two visits, as there is too much else to mention here.. I kept giving it another try hoping the old familiar place would be back, but last night was the LAST straw.  Yesterday - My son ordered a plain hamburger. It arrived with a BITE taken out of the meat. Yes, a bite. Maybe it was just a fluke and the patty happened to be shaped that way? But this SCREAMS re-plating.  Also, I am vegetarian and ordered a wedge salad with NO BACON. The first one came with EXTRA BACON. Sent it back. The 2nd one came with a little bit of bacon tucked under some of the dressing like they either scraped off the other one, or somebody thought it was funny to throw a little bacon in there so I wouldn't notice because I sent it back. Insulting. As a side note, roughly half of the time that I order a garden patty on my burger, they send real meat and I have to send it back. Anyway, on this occasion the manager came over and apologized and took care of our check. Its sad that he had to do that. He will never have to do that again if he properly trains his staff.  A few weeks ago we were there - Our waitress was DRUNK. It was me and my kids again. I ordered ONE beer, and I was the only one at the table old enough to drink. A while later a different server arrives with TWO beers. Huh??? I send one back. It makes me wonder if the waitress wasn't hoping to keep one for herself. She had slurred speech and was quite obviously intoxicated. A short time later I was actually ready for a 2nd one, and it never arrived.  Many of the wonderful servers that used to work there I noticed are no longer present. Many of them knew my family by name because we go there so much. Now it seems the turnover is high and staff is not properly trained.  I'm very sad that I have to give up on this RR.

Good food. Fast service. I was sitting at a high table near the bar. The bartender was loud. Dropping f bombs to a friend im assuming that was a customer. Talking about a whip cream game that uses c02 canisters that gets you high. Saying its a crack heads game. Very unprofessional.
Slow service.   If you come here for lunch on a weekday, make sure you have plenty of time.
Raw chicken! Manager said "give you discount" WHAT! My daughters chickens was raw! Sickening!

Good place for groups. The food is tasty and the waitess/waiters are helpful & nice. I luuuurv their bottomless fries w/ their ranch...Sooo Delish. & Im a fan for their bottomless Strawberry freckled Lemonades. Tasty good.

I love coming here for dinner. They have some really good food and drinks. Sometimes there service can be kind of slow or they can mess up your order but even when that happens they know how to correct there mistake and make everything good.

Oh dude, I'm one of those people that have ordered the same exact thing since high school: The Western BBQ Burger.  Have you tried their Beer Float?  Oh Em Gee Becky!  Guinness Stout, Irish whisky, and CHOCOLATE ICE CREAM?!   So I came in one day 'cause I thought... hey... I think I deserve a good burger that'll give me a blast from the past!  I've been eating pretty good lately and got rid of hella weight I might as well.  I got myself a freckled lemonade and I'll have to admit if any bar made that... I sure would stop being an alcoholic.  I got my usual with a side of sweat potato fries and got this plate that looks all fancy.  The fries wasn't as much as I remembered it 'cause they got it all hoarded together in his metal contraption thing (it has no bottom... better not be a pun to their "bottomless fries").  I had my burger cut in half so I could save it for later and asked for more fries.  The waitress comes back with a red basket of fries and about ten minutes later I ask for a box.  She gives me a small box and I thought... Hey, make it simple and just take the paper the fries were on and just put it in the box! So I did.  Dude, the bottom of the basket was HELLA GNARLY. Not just hella gnarly but HELLA GNARLY (high emphasis on capital letters).  There was old ketchup on the bottom of the basket that was incrusted in between the spaces of the basket, crumbs from what looks like the past meal that was placed in there!! I wanted to barf... Get that thing away from me!   Ya.. sure it doesn't directly touch my food but shit... if I see that shit on the bottom of a plate that I just ate off of... I'm throwing the worst menstrual fit EVER.  PASS NOT SMASH!

The food is not necessarily healthy by any stretch, but it is most definately good comfort food.  The service is exceptional.  It would be 5 stars, except my clam chowder came out with my food, and I would have much preferred it before.  Can't leave Red Robin without the Onion Ring Towers!  And if you go here, please ask for Nicole, she is friendly, efficient and she works hard!

Food was good. It's the RR standard. The service, however, was not so great. We weren't very demanding but asked for knives - never got them. Asked for bbq sauce twice, got it after second request. We wrote down our phone # for the loyalty points, he didn't run it. Then took our line item receipt to run it. We waited around for that receipt, but he never came back. We suspect he didn't run it at all. Oh well. We were driving through so we probably (thankfully) will not be out to this one again anytime soon.
Food was superb! Love my Banzai Burger!  But service was okay, waitress didn't tell me her name so it was hard trying to flag her down for sauce or refills.

This place has the absolute worst service! Waited over twenty minutes for our drink order to be taken, then waited an additional twenty minutes for them to come. Our appetizers came out after our entrées. The hostess and waitress were both extremely rude and impolite. The food didn't even make up for it, cold hard fries served with our burgers. Never got refills on our drinks. I definitely would not recommend this place.

Lots of burgers and fried goodness.  Burgers are decently sized.  Bottomless fries are always a plus if you can even get a second helping!  Service was OK.  Slow, and hardly checked on us.  Not a place we frequent often or will frequent often.

Worst service in a while, haven't had red robin in a long time and thought it would be cool to grab some burgers. Our server Angela wasn't very attentive and our burgers got to our table within a hour of waiting. There have been other tables around us getting their food before us after getting sat after us. Anyway, I don't think I'll be going to red robin for awhile.
Yesterday I was served a bloody chicken salad. I added the picture for your viewing pleasure. Waitress was ok about it & took it off the bill. No one apologized. I will or return.

Okay, where do I begin? My husband and I have given this place many attempts to redeem itself, but I think this visit will be our last. We've been coming to this location since were in high school. So we have literally watch this place take its turn for the worst.  The food is so-so but I gave this place one star because of the service. The service is terrible. If i have to go to the bathroom to get napkins to wipe our face and hands, you fail at your job. We received no napkins or silverware.  We saw our server a total of 2 times, when she ordered our food and when she brought it out. Our drinks had to be refilled by the manager but only because we waived him down. We complained, but it didn't seem to do any good. One server was clearing plates from his customers table and dropped forks and spilled sauce all over the floor. It even got in another customer. I saw him look at what he dropped, but did he return to clean it up? No. He didn't even let a busser know. I expect that when i speak to a manager about his server that he would let her know to be more attentive to her table. Its not like we wanted her to sit at our table and wait until we needed something, but we didn't even get the bare minimum of what i think a server should be doing. Clearly, they need to do more server training.  The reason we came back was because our server from the last 2 times was outstanding (her name is Jessica ). Honestly all of their servers should take tips from her, or she needs to be the manager of this location. The food isn't good enough to deal with this type of service.  If you decide to go to this place,  ask for Jessica and your experience will be fine. Otherwise,  don't  come here.

Won't go back to this location. Horrible service and you have to try pretty hard to mess up a salad. I could open up a bag of salad greens at home. We were led to seats at the bar even though there were many tables available. Our server took our order and left. We (and other nearby customers) put on the "call sever" light on the machine designed to eliminate people and when our server final showed up she said "It doesn't actually call a server". No drink refills or fry refills offered during our meal. We had to wait to even pay our bill. Bad corporate decision to try to eliminate human contact. We were told that they would prefer that we order things without servers at other locations. Dislike.

Let me start with a THANK YOU to Martha. My waitress was super nice and friendly. She made sure all my expectations were met and constantly checked on us. I wouldve given Red Robin a full set of stars if they did not make bitter people as managers. I had a much better time dealing with my server than him.  Thanks again Martha and I hope to see you soon. (:

Where to start...was really excited to eat here again and was really looking forward to my Bonzai burger that I normally get. I brought my brother and mother along. Once we were seated and placed our order, it took much longer than it normally did; and I've been here (and other Red Robin locations) when it was more full. I ordered my burger medium done. The food finally came, and I ate my fries first, which did not take too long because there were only around 10 pieces. I took my craving bite into my bonzai burger, only to see that it was prepared well done. I am not the type that likes to waste food, so I did not complain and just ate it, disappointed. We were given napkins and knives, but no forks, which I have always been given in the past considering these are gourmet burgers. My mother called our server over and asked for a fork, and my brother and I asked for more fries. She said okay, and that the fries would take 3 to 5 minutes. My brother and I finished our burgers, and my mother finished her sandwich, and a fork was never given. At this point, no fries were given either, and I saw other parties getting fries. At this point, more time has passed by than us waiting for our burgers in the beginning, and still no fries. Our server finally came back with just one basket of fries, and never gave us a fork, which would have been pointless at this point since we all finished our burgers/sandwiches. Having been to this location many times, all of this was a huge disappointment, and this was the only time I ever felt that a server did not receive a tip of any amount. Instead of receiving bottomless fries, we received bottomless disappointment. It will be a while before I dine at this location again. I would advise this particular server to communicate realistic times to customers instead of giving random, short times. Also, carry around a notepad so that she can remember what the customer(s) asked for. This location has really gone downhill compared to my previous times eating here.

Okay so before I write this review I would like to state that I work in a restaurant, therefore I can appreciate the hard work it takes for everybody part of making it function. We walked in & it took about 5 minutes to be acknowledged. There was a woman standing at the station right beside us gathering checks for a party of 4 who apparently all wanted separate checks. It's a little more of a hassle when people ask for that-I know. However I didn't even get a "be right with you" or anything. She proceeded to drop off the checks & check on a few other tables, count some cash from her apron, & walk out of sight. Finally a lady came to seat us and I was already a little frustrated because I was hungry.  We were seated, a woman asked for our drink orders and she must've been new cause she was confused when I asked for the Thorny Señorita Rita and I had to point it out on the menu. She didn't ask whether I wanted it on the rocks or blended and I forgot to specify, and she didn't card me. I just turned 21 earlier this month so getting carded is somewhat fun for me because I finally have the proof! But anyways, our waiter was a different young man and was very nice. He took our orders and I asked him to make sure my drink was on the rocks. Our food came out, it was not good. I ordered the fish & chips and a cup of clam chowder to share with my sister, my mom ordered a cup of tortilla soup. The chips tasted stale, the soup was room temperature, & the bread that came with it was stale as well. The fish tasted fresh and pleasant but it was the only thing I really enjoyed. I asked for my soup to be re-warmed and they did it. In my restaurant, when something is cold, we have it re-made completely but I doubt the soup here is made to order. By this time my margarita still hadn't come out. Our server kept checking on it and it wasn't ready. I didn't want to make things difficult for him because I hate when customers blame me for things that go wrong in the kitchen and I ate it anyways because I was too hungry to wait for it to be re-made. A review for a restaurant as big as Red Robin probably won't make any difference, people will still come. However I hope they work these things out to become better.

DO NOT EAT HERE! BUG INFESTATION! I went here for lunch today while doing a little holiday shopping with my dad. Upon seating, we noticed that the silverware looked old. Not dirty, but definitely needed replaced. Not that big of a deal. When I received my burger which I ordered with no mayo and the garlic herb fries, not only were the fries incorrect, but there was mayo on my burger. I wasn't going to send the fries back, not such a big deal, but the mayo is for me. The waitress didn't even apologize for the mistake, only offered to fix it. My second burger finally arrives, and I hear commotion at the table behind me. I'll leave the four-letter explicative out. They were getting up to leave because on the wall right next to their table was a roach! I understand that pests are a part of the food business, but when one comes out during the day, there must be a huge infestation of them somewhere in the building! So gross! I almost vomited. My dad and I left with the table behind us and I told the people waiting in line to get a table on our way out. They also proceeded to leave. I still have the creeps!

Well I have to say since they have redone this red robin. We have been very disappointed. We walked out the first time because the bartender was having a fit. And there was lipstick on my wine glass. The 2nd time. The server was sweet but slow. And supposedly the bartender went MIA. IT TOOK A GOOD 15 mins. And this was one of our favorite places. Don't know what they are doing.  But it isn't working.

We came in about an hour before closing and the staff were rushing us out. We were placed at a table with no napkins or silverware and did not receive any until our appatizers were served. The onion ring tower was great but my prime rib sandwich could have been better.

My wife and I have come here frequently over the years.  Used to be good for this type of restaurant, now it is really bad.  Her beer came with appetizers...two black hairs and encrusted food on the glass!  Even though these appetizers were free, we passed on them.  Clearly, management doesn't care our does not know how to manage.  The menus were grimy, the booths were crusted with goo.  New jingle....Red Robin, ugh! BTW, at least 20 tables were un-bussed.

This Red Robin has gone down hill tremendously and quick!  While the food is just what you expect from a mall restaurant the service has pretty much hit rock bottom (again). My family has been coming year for quite some time and there has always been service issues. Whether it be slow, wrong, or just lazy it never quite gets high marks. Even at one visit a couple of years ago my wife made a comment to our server about the lack of organization and gaps in service to which the server went on to explain that the whole management staff was just fired and everyone working that day was replacements. This actually gave a ray of hope for the restaurant. We understood the chaos that could be brought on by a sudden change in leadership and embraced the fact that finally service might actually get better. I did...for a little while. Soon enough it was back to the inconsistency we have found to be the norm at this location. Fast forward to last night. We (7 of us) arrived at about 7:00p on a Wednesday evening...not very crowded. Actually about at 50% capacity if not less. However, with the amount of time we saw our server you would think that she was covering the entire restaurant herself. She took our drink order, then our food order, delivered food and that was about it. No refills, not coming by to check on us (even though other servers did and so did the manager). We asked for more condiments which were brought by another employee about 10 minutes later. My wife asked for a spoon for our son right when the food was brought out, she never came back. My wife went and got one herself. THEN 10 minutes after that, after our son had finished his meal she brought the spoon acting like we had just asked for it. Still no one had offered refills or anything. The server came back and pretty much offered us anything we wanted since she was doing such a bad job. Any food we wanted a "refill" on we could have....Kind of weird but whatever. After we had finished eating we waited....and waited...and WAITED for about 30 minutes for our check. Not only did we have to wait, we had to get another server to get the manager to get our check. Our server pretty much stopped caring and never came back.  Luckily the manager comped some of the meals but really thats not the point. It was just embarrassing how bad the service was and how little they seemed to care about it. Just as we were leaving the server came back and acted like she was trying to save face or something but gave a very lackluster "apology" and went on her way again.  Im sure we will go back at some point but we will never go to Red Robin when it is actually busy or when we are in a hurry. There is no telling how long you will have to wait for a spoon or your check. Dont go thirsty either, unless one glass of water is ok for an hour.

Service was extremely slow. When my family and I arrived, a party of 5 was complaining to the check in member since they waited so long and kept watching others be seated ahead of them. He stated there was a conflict with two iPads. They got fed up and left. When we got seated we noticed several empty tables not sure why such a long wait. Our server was rude and would ignore us and seemed very brief when we were talking with her. She took our order wrong and tried to tell us that we had to accept the food despite her mistake. The food was ok but not worth the wait or the service. I would avoid this place if possible.

Service at this red robin is always a hit or miss. They fucked up on my order of a salad and put the wrong chicken on it. How simple is just to make a salad, and it wasn't even busy in there. But our waiter Jhenie was kind enough to fix it for us, so it wasn't too bad. Also the fries are hit or miss, they can be soggy. I prefer it crispy but they always seem to mess up. Oh we'll probably won't come here again

I've never walked out of a restaurant before tonight. It took several minutes for a host to even appear to get us seated, and once we were seated, we waited for about 10 minutes, 5 of which with our little server light blinking, Before we finally has a waitress approach us and explain that she wasn't our waitress but she'd help since we hadn't been helped. She realized we didn't even have place settings yet, went to get them, and never came back. We tapped another waitress and asked for her help, she said she'd get our waitress and disappeared. A third came by and said she's help us as soon as she helped this other table. We waited a total of about 20 minutes and didn't have water, utensils, or anything. My 3 year old was starving, so we kept waiting rather than starting over somewhere else, but at that point, I was livid. We went to Buffalo Wild Wings where the server rushed a plate of veggies out to calm my very hungry son who was melting down. Blown away. Red Robin - Worst service ever.

If I can rate this place with no stars I will. Bad customers service. Please don't eat at this place. If you guys are craving for a burger, just eat at In and Out, at least it's cheaper and has better customer service. I feel sorry for the staff, because they manifestly look overwork and unhappy with their jobs.

I've been wanting to try Red Robin ever since seeing those Red Robinnnnn commercials.  Lucky for me, the Westfield at Fairfield has a Red Robin.  The entrance for Red Robin is on the first floor of the mall and lacks a podium for a hostess, which is an issue: being that it was a Friday night, there were plenty of people trying to get in. Subsequently, there's no organization and I was quickly annoyed. Nevertheless once on the list, the wait was short and we were seated in less than ten minutes.  The restaurant resembles Applebees, both in price and atmosphere. The food offering is "Gourmet Burgers" and other American dishes.  I'd definitely say the biggest draw is their burgers, but their sandwich offerings sounded too good to pass up.  I settled on the Bruschetta Chicken Sandwich, which consisted of grilled chicken, bruschetta (on a sandwich!), pesto aioloi, provolone cheese, lettuce, and balsamic cream all on a rustic ciabatta roll.  Sandwiches come with bottomless steak-cut fires, which I opted to substitute with some steamed veggies. The sandwich was on par with some of the better delis I've tried.  The ciabatta bread was fresh and fluffy.  The bruschetta and pesto was an amazing combination, along with the perfectly grilled and seasoned chicken.  The provolone cheese gave it that last bit of perfection. I skipped on the fries, but I'm sure they would of been a perfect combination. All in all, I was really impressed with the quality of food and its price and value were just as great.  Our server was friendly and did a decent job of serving us.  She did disappear toward the end of our service, but its not a huge deal.  I'll definitely be back to try some of their other signature sandwiches and steak-cut fries. Ambiance: 4 Stars (out of 5) Food: 4 Stars (out of 5) Service: 3 Stars (out of 5) Price:  $ (out of 4) Overall: 4 Stars (out of 5)

We were seated at 5pm and received water but no one came to take our order until 5:40pm. We were one of probably 8 tables and the waitstaff just walked past us like we were invisible. Terrible service, but it's the only RR in the area.
Kids love this place and they are able to accommodate food allergies. Service was good on this trip. Has been a bit slow in the past.

There is a reason I don't eat here often, and I realized why tonight. We were seated right away but it seemed forever for the waitress to come and take our order. The hostess took our drink orders and didn't seem like she knew what was going on. After about 10 minutes the waitress finally came to take our order. At this point it seemed like things were going to go great. High hopes, and high dreams.  The food took forever, at one point we saw the food on the counter and watched it sit there for another 10 minutes. So by the time everything came it was pretty cold. I order the sweet potato fries, they cam out not so sweet but burnt. You would think a burger place could get fries right. I guess that would be asking to much. The steak fries were also cold.  Things were so slow that it reminded me of why I don't come to this place. The waitress seemed to be having a conversation with her friends at another table.  It will be a while before I return to the slow robin, I mean Red Robin. The only thing that was getting Robin was me.
So , my family and I have been sitting here for 20 minutes no drinks no service! Get some new management asap!

Whenever I am feening for some good chicken strips, steak fries and a burger I hit up Red Robin.  Their clucks and fries never disappoint. They're always crispy and very tender.  The bottomless fries along with their house spice is the bomb dot com.  If I want a burger I will get a Royal burger which is bacon, cheese, lettuce, tomato and a fried egg on top of a medium rare meat patty.  Mmmm just writing about makes my mouth water.  I have only encountered one problem at this location but the manager was sure to make things right by giving me a $25 gift card and asking us to check in with her each time we came in.  I thought that was class service.  I feel like this location has better food and service compared to the Pleasant Hill location. Oh and I wanted to mention I'm not a milkshake person but when Red Robin offered the gingerbread milkshake I had to try it and it totally changed my mind about milkshakes.  I'm picky about them and theirs was delicious! I think that one was seasonal so you would have to wait for winter.

I love burgers. And red robin is usually great, but this one not so much. I always order the burnin love burger and their fries are usually amazing. But I feel like nowadays they're getting stingy with the "bottomless fries" AND MY BURGER WAS BURNT AND HARD. Not only that, but my dad ordered a clam chowder bowl. And they forgot about it. Really? You have one job to do and you forget a simple bowl of soup. I mean they deducted it from our tab but still.

The experience tonight was very disturbing with the remodel going on! 45 minutes to get my beverage not the waiters fault it was the Bartenders the floor was so sticky I could barely walk I felt really bad for the waiter she was so nice but it's only getting business cause the movie and people walking in the mall starving! I will never go back.

Omg. I have not been to this red robin in a few years and went there tonight and it was terrible. The waiter was running around crazy busy and could not do his job well at all as he appeared to get more overwhelmed as more customers came in. Went there to celebrate my moms 82 birthday. Told the hostess and waiter both we were celebrating her birthday and thru did nothing. After reminding the waiter he said I forgot. But you have to wait. Kinda brushed us off so I decided to pay And get the hell out if there. Never again will I go back there. Bad bad bad.

If I could give this establishment a zero I would.  We came in through the mall and waited where it states to wait for the hostess.  After about ten minutes with waitresses going by no one came to seat us.  There  were many eye contacts with the staff yet my party didn't get any host or hostess to come and take us to any available seats.  Yes  we indeed left and went to Buffalo Wild Wings.  We were bring our daughter for her birthday.  Oh well.

This was the worst experience ever here. Normally we get good service, but tonight was the worst service ever. We didn't receive our waters until after we received out beers. The server didn't come to out table and ask of we needed anything and the manager Juan acted as if I didn't make a complaint at all. I will never come back to Red Robin again. The food came out once again wrong and it's almost ten and we have kids that need to be in bed for school.

I was at the bar and there wasn't a bartender for at least five minutes. The bartender finally came and asked for my order. I asked for a beer on tap. She spent another few minutes making other drinks and counting money and didn't say "give me a moment." Finally, she pours me a drink and hands me a check. Came out to be $6. I gave her $10 bill. She says thank you and never gave me back change and she left. I literally had to chase her to ask for my change. She finally gives me change with a condescending look. Wow!
Utensils were dirty,  kinda gross.  Burger was good though,  got the blu ribbon. They skimpt on the bottomless fries and service was slow.

I went in today a little before two, not busy at all, yet it took like ten minutes for the waiter to come to ask us for drinks. There was about a waiter per table and our food took about 35 minutes to get to us (two hamburgers was all). The waiter rudely slammed our food on the table and left without saying anything, after she had taken another 10 minutes to take our water. She never came around to ask if we needed anything else. The manager saw we had pressed the button on the machine on the table "call server" and just walked away. Took another 10 minutes to get a to-go cup! We were seated next to the kitchen area and could see most of the waiters including the manager were just hanging around most of the time when they could have checked on the tables more! Disappointed to say the least!

Service wasn't great but the food was!  The peppercorn A-1 burger, steak sliders were very good. Mac n cheese could have been better.  They were very generous w/their alcohol.... for this alone I will be back.  Lastly, the bottomless fries never hurt any body and i think they feel offended if you don't ask for another basket or two.  So don't be shy.  Ask for more fries and season them up w/ the special red robbin mix!

I always love their burgers. My favorite is the Bleu Ribbon burger. This past time we went it was especially delicious! I only don't give them more stars because the service isn't always great. Last time the waitress hardly checked on us and they weren't busy when we came in.

Like I previously stated in my Concord and Vacaville reviews, I would give this 4 stars for my love of Red Robin as a whole. The 3 stars is just for this location. Something about this location just feels cramped. And its kind of awkward that people doing their mall shopping can just stop and watch you eat your food. The last particular time I came to Red Robin, we cam for happy hour.  We ordered: 2 margarita's 1 order of happy hour nachos I swear we order things other than margarita's and nachos, we just seem to be on this trend lately. Anywhoo. Service was kind of slow with the drinks, but there was only one bartender on staff and the bar was busier than the rest of the restaurant. When we did get the margaritas they were the tasty standard you expect. Then it went all wrong. The nachos came out and all looked well until we started digging in and realized 95% of the nacho topping was black beans. Basically just tortilla chips that had a can of undrained black beans dumped. Why we didn't send them back, I don't know. We kept telling ourselves "oh the rest of the toppings are underneath this next layer". Stupid I know. At least we had a little bit of guacamole and sour cream. We finally found the "cheeseburger queso" at the bottom of the plate. I felt so let down, RR had never failed me before! I don't know if this is just the happy hour version, but these were awful. I would give them .5 a star for the tasty guacamole. I'm sure we will be back to this particular location but stick to what we know.

My husband and I had been to this Red Robin several times and the service was always less than great.  We kept coming back because it is so convenient being in the mall.  A couple nights ago we decided to sit at the bar and I'm so glad we did.  SYDNEY was working and let me say, SHE IS AWESOME!  Service was great, food was perfect and she has a wonderful personality.  She checked on us constantly, always smiling.   Make sure you sit at the bar and make sure SYDNEY takes care of you.  Red Robin should have her train the entire staff!

I love Red Robin but I hate this one. The food is gross. The customer service is hit or miss. I ordered fried mushrooms and they came out soggy. Grossed out just thinking about it. I will never  come again the food was horrible the service  was bad NEVER AGAIN I will give it no STARS but it doesn't  give me the option

I actually gave Red Robins a second chance which I truly regret considering my most recent visit was just like my first one they took for ever to place us at our tables when they finally did they placed us out in their patio inside the mall while still under construction they had tiles missing so you had to watch your step a couple of the construction workers were a bit distracting plastic hanging from the ceiling separating sections in the restaurant the table wasn't set etc. The waitress messed up our orders I ordered the smoke and pepper gourmet burger medium rare when it finally came which literally took about 45 minutes (they tried to make up for the wait with their endless fries that looked like they were grabbed with their hands and smashed) it was over cooked and cold on top of that there was a hair in my salad which totally ruined my appetite I definitely will not be going to visit Red Robins ever again.

Horrible service waitress walked by me 4 times never asked if I wanted anything had to walk to bar to get another beer then she forgot my sauce I asked for previously she never brought it never got a chance for more fries wont be back

When we entered, half the restaurant was not filled and the person seating people was already ready to leave. We were seated in the back, more towards, the entrance to the mall. Our waiter, Corey, was always making sure our drinks were refilled, the food was tasting well, everything up to our standards. So after we paid, my friend had to use the restroom, and we all completely forgot about the food we had in our to-go box. After she finished using the restroom, we left, and we're about more than halfway to my car and all of a sudden, we heard, "HEY!!!" We quickly turned around and it was our waiter Corey running towards us with my friend's to-go box in his hands. He wanted to make sure she still wanted it. We were completely blown away and very shocked of how generous he was. Thanks Corey! We're going to continue to ask for you to be our waiter! You were outstanding :)

Went here on a friday night.Waitress Melissa was rude and unfriendly. She took our orders and didnt come back to check on us...and I only went here because of the so called bottomless fries and drinks. I love red robins but I wont be coming to this ever again.

I really loved the service starting from the time we walked in. Food was hot looked appetizing and had great flavor. Our waitress Jessica refilled our drinks and bottomless fries she also checked up on us regularly. Thank you RedRobyn for your Great service and delicious burgers. My family and I will be returning to this FF RedRobyn restaurant.

I don't visit Red Robin often, but when I do, the food is consistent.  I ordered a whiskey BBQ chicken wrap with freckled fruit salad, my friend ordered a royal red robin burger with fries and her son had a pepperoni pizza with mandarin oranges,  we also redeemed a Facebook coupon offer for an order of free sweet potato fries.  They claim it comes with a side of "spicy ketchup" sauce, but it all honesty it's just sweet chili sauce.  It was good, but I'd rather order the tower of onion rings. My lack of two more stars is due to our server. 1. She was pretty spacey. 2. She forgot to enter the coupon for the free appetizer. 3. HER NAILS WERE DIRTY!!!! For me to give a "chain" restaurant a four star rating is odd, as I usually avoid the cookie-cutter eateries. But, I have to be fair, and honest. It's funny to me, almost unusual, that Red Robin has the best fish and chips in town, better than any of the independent specific places that are geared only towards this meal. Here's the deal: Red Robin calls it "Arctic Cod Fish and Chips". Whatever. The filets are always just right crispy, there's and endless supply of large cut fries, and they always, without complaint, bring me extra lemon wedges for my fish. Now for the kicker. Their tartar sauce, which has lots of dill and a secret ingredient, is the bomb. Not in the least mayonnaise tasting, it makes a wonderful dip for the fries! Go figure. Not greasy or oily in the slightest. Just wonderful. It's a recipe that they've got right. Who'da thunk it? Best fish and chips in town at a chain burger joint. Huh! Wash it all down with a real milkshake with extra in the tin cup, and you're good to go. A complete meal, if a lit bit guilty. Then, head right upstairs to the movie theater for the latest flick. Perfect. The only downside is that you need a booth. Their little tables for two are just that. Little. Hardly room to set down your cellphone, sunglasses and newspaper. Midget size. Get a booth and be comfortable. Wee but noisy, too. But, it's a family place in the mall, so  you expect some noise. The food comes pretty quick, and is consistent. I'll be back!

Well, I am not a huge chain restaurant fan, but due to me being at the mall and not wanting Chik-fila again, I chose to grab a bite here. After all, how bad could it be? It was getting near closing for the mall so we got our car from the other end and parked at the outside entrance. Getting closer to the door, we see the pack of nicotine freaks,employees and customers alike, huddled under the stairs about ten feet from door. We are bombarded with the scent of smoke and another smell most resembling sewage. You would think that would have turned us back immediately, but we must have been ready for adventure, cause we just commented on the stink and continued inside. We were greeted by a very friendly server and seated right away.We got what I felt was the best seat in the place, it was on the far edge where we could see the mall while we ate. That's where the good times ended.       Our server came by table to let us know that he would be back in a second. We didn't see him again for 5 mins or so. Then when he returns and asks us what we wanted to start the meal with, he seems bummed out that we only wanted to order our meals and not get any appetizers. After about 10 minutes, we hear him tell the tables behind us that he is sorry about the wait, something has happened in kitchen and has slowed down the food. Where is our apology, or our drinks? He must have read our minds because he quickly shows up with our drinks and does a little song and dance about the wait. Finally, our food arrives. As my rating states, Meh I've seen better. maybe the servings were small due to the promise of bottomless fries, but when I spend $12 on a chick sand, I expect  the sandwich to be the HNIC of my plate.       Don't get me wrong, the chicken had good flavor, but it was smaller than my hand and was gone in what seemed like much too short a time for a twelve dollar burger. I am not a huge french-fry fan and for what we paid, we could have been ass deep in Chik-Fila or even a Carl's Jr Chicken sandwich would have killed what we were served. Our waiter didn't come back around until it was obvious that we were finished and our glasses were empty for most of our dinner. He had a little smirk and tried to be upbeat, but I think he knew what he was serving was like slapping each customer in the mouth. 2 stars because the sandwich had good flavor, 0 stars for the rest of the bullshit. Life is about learning and I have learned my lesson. The only redeeming part of this meal was, at least, it didn't give me the bubble guts...
