We ordered our burgers, my husband has pretty specific taste, and ALWAYS orders no mayo and no onion. Pretty easy right?  well about 20 minutes later I get my burger, I'm now waiting for my husbands food to come so we can eat, about 10 more minutes go by while my food is getting cold, we could not find our waitress so we asked another one, she brings a cold burger slathered with mayo and of course plenty of onions.  We sent it back, about 30 seconds later our original waitress reappears with the burger we just sent back, she sets it down in front of my husband and says (with much attitude and a raised voice) "this is what you ordered!" I was about to come across the table at her, i mean, Really? but then it got worst! She whips out her ordering pad and shoves it in his face to show him what she wrote down. I asked her to leave us and bring her manager, some time later the "manager" showed up and all she could do was offer us the reassurance that our waitress wasn't actually a waitress but a bartender who was helping out.  By the end of a crappy hour at Red Robin, we both left starving and angry. and we were offered nothing for our trouble, yes, we paid for our uneaten CRAP! Never again! NEVER AGAIN!!

Wow, we stopped by on the way to Reno and I was quite impressed. The service was A class! At first you just feel, she probably just wants her tip, but by the end I felt that I wanted to tip her for the great prompt service. Water refills, fries refills, asking if we need anything, order taking, all came at perfect timing.  Even at this, the waitress apologized for the delay. All Red Robins is probably like this, but everything was done efficiently, one person making sure we are ok, one person assigned to bring out the food, another person to seat and a manager helping out where needed. A+, Great job guys!  This is one of the few times I felt good tipping 20%

Bottomless fries?  Bottomless drinks?  I'm there.  I've been a fan of Red Robin for years and used to eat at their locations in Colorado. This one is closest to my house so it gets me now.  There are definitely rush periods and it's easier to just avoid. Friday night and Saturday lunch and dinner come to mind.  I recommend the Banzai burger with relish and a fried egg. Your tummy will thank you.

I have been here only once a year for the past two years. Service was only ok. Nothing to really complain about, but nothing to really rave about either. The sever this last time needs a bit more training in sanitation habits. We saw her blow her nose then proceed to place straws in our drinks without washing her hands. Yuck! Who knows wether she washes her hands after a trip to the bathroom. Food was served pretty quickly, but quality was mediocre. Would I come back?, eh I dunno pretty turn off from the last visit. Not so much so if someone I hang out with wanted to go, but probably wouldn't go if it was up to me.

Hello All, my husband and I were shocked to learn that Blue Frog has become a Fudruckers :( so sad as we were up at the Fairfield mall having to do some shopping and figured we had not been to Red Robin in a while so we would give it another chance as our second choice would have been Mimis but they have gone down hill (thats another story...) anyway, ordered a BLTA (turkey on a croissant) asked for no bacon... simple enough as it was only a snack so we could finish shopping....well it arrived and the yes bacon was on it and the fries with it tasted like they had been living under a heat lamp for a few hours, rubbery and no flavor...not like they used to make them crisp outside and fluffy insides...so we complained because it bugged us...and the only saving grace was Cassandra our nice waitress who comped our meal...which she did not have to do and we left a tip anyway...we now may give it one more try but if its like that again then we must turn our backs on this establishment.....

I received a birthday coupon to get a free burger here.  That really wasn't even close enough of a reason to come here. In the past and more than once I've received terrible service from this location.  You'd think I would learn my lesson the last time and just when you think service can't get any worse, it does..... First of all when you walk up to get a table they say that the wait is about 20-25 minutes which is fine, but when you see maybe a quarter of the tables empty and they aren't calling anyone something has to be up.  But they don't tell you what is going on and I watched the person calling names just keep looking at the clock before calling people.  I'm pretty sure they were literally waiting for each person to have been waiting for 20-25 minutes before seating.  (Later on in the evening I heard the manager telling another employee that they were making people wait longer rather than seating.)  At that point I wasn't entirely sure what was going on but that should have been a good indicator that I should run the other way. When we finally got seated it took a couple of minutes for the waiter to take our order, but it took at least 15 minute just to get our drinks.  Then another 10-15 minutes just to get our onion rings.  So at about 30 minutes that was more or less the last time we saw our waiter for the next 30 minutes.  An hour after being seated our waiter comes by and tells us that the manager will be around shortly to explain what was going on.  He never showed up at our table, but I saw him stop by a lot of other tables....We were getting pretty annoyed at this point.  Our waiter came by again and said that our food was coming right out in a few minutes...(didn't happen).  Then he started bringing out fries to tables, but this was over an hour after being seated and I just wanted my food so I could get out of there.  I believe after about an hour and a half we finally got our burgers.  They messed up our bill so it took even longer to pay but when we finally got out of there, it was basically 2 hours wasted. I believe in the past we waited upwards of 20 minutes just to pay the bill, so I'm not convinced this is an isolated incident.  I won't be returning again...
With the wife needing to be gluten free.it's nice there are trying but can only give 2 stars.need to train there staff better.
I just don't see what's so hot about this place, their burgers are just like any other outhere, its always crowded with people their service is not the best, burgers are ok. Missing the wow factor

Stopped in for lunch after shopping. Service was excellent and food was better than expected. Chose the turkey burger with sweet potato fries and was pleasantly surprised how good they were. I don't make a habit out of eating at places in a mall but I would go back here.

I am not sure if this is the one in the mall, but my experience is kinda been the same at every RR.  SUX! I was seated and the goofy waiter came over and it took him 3 seperate times to get the beer I wanted and when he did get it to me it was the wrong size.  I was like this kid is trying to up sale me sneakingly! So I complained and he only charged me for the small size, ooh lucky me.  the food is always pretty average. my fault! when will I learn.

You know... it was just average... not that I was expecting much for a Chili's type located in the mall.  The drinks were okay and affordable, although mostly mix and sugar, not much buzz factor. I will not order a drink there again.  I got the 5 alarm burger, it was not that hot. If you are going to advertise something as super spicy, it should be spicy.  My husband got the blackened burger, his was pretty good. If we went again I would order his.  For the two of us and two drinks and tip it was 41.00. I would have been just as satisfied if I went to In-N-Out.
Food here is over price and the hamburgers iz not all tht...... Service was good.....

I know I'm super late, our last visit was 07/30/13 but I must share my experience.  Our server was semi on Q but that's just bc he did better than the rest of the staff.  We sat as close to the kitchen as you could get, there were three men working back there, two Spanish & one African American (AA).  The AA was eating while cooking & never once washed his hands or looked up at anything going on around him.   When we got our food it wasn't until I almost ate the whole burger that I noticed a hair...clearly I could tell it came from the AA.  Our waiter got the manager on duty as we requested bc I felt she needed to know what was going on in the kitchen.  The other two gentlemen had super short hair & the AA had super long dreads that weren't in any way covered, pulled back or anything.  I told the ASM we seen him eating not washing his hands & felt strongly the hair in my food came from him.  As I also politely explained I wasn't just trying to tell her how to do her job but when the customers can see what the staff is doing when she can't this was just a way to let her know maybe he could use a hair net or some form to prevent this & maybe watch him a little more closely bc it doesn't seem he cared about his job at all.  She left our table called him to the side, he put in a rubber band & went right back to preparing food without washing his hands.  The most upsetting part is the ASM told him which table was making the complaint bc he stared at us the whole time none other than passing by our table getting a cup of soda & walking back to the serving line...A cook that doesn't care about his job, sure there are plenty of them but not normally in sight of the customer!  As for the ASM if she is that oblivious as to what's going on around her, she shouldn't be in the restaurant industry.

Worse service we have ever had. We were sat down right away and had our orders taken when we got our drink orders taken. We get our drinks and some fries and wait for our food. Two tables were sat down after us and received their food before us. Our server sees we are done with our fries and says I will get you your bill. I look over at my girlfriend and ask did she just say "i'lll go get you your bill?" My girlfriend says i think so. We wait till the server comes back and she does bring us our check. We tell her we never got our food. She replies in a shocked voice "Are you serious." In our heads we are thinking how can you forget, you never brought us our food. Without even giving any apology she just says i will be right back. My girlfriend was very upset and she got up and asked the first server if we can speak to a manager. The manager comes over within a few minutes, and my girlfriend explains the situation, and again the manager didnt really say i am sorry. We say can we please just pay for our drinks and go. The manager says no let me go check on your food. The manager does eventually come with food and it is completely the wrong order. After we tell her it's the wrong order she goes back again to check on our order. The third time she comes back to our table she says i am sorry for what happened and says our drinks and food is free and she offers us a gift card. We take take the gift card and decide to just leave. I've had bad service in the past but never this bad. The fact that we never got our food we were hungry and the server who's name is SARAH by the way, didnt even say sorry or come back to our table made the situation even worse. Red Robin has always been one of our favorite places to eat but we will never come back to this location.

Freckled Lemonade....mmmmmmm....I've missed you, my friend.  :)  Had a great lunch today that really hit the spot - BBQ chicken wrap was as good as it looked in the photo and the clam chower was pretty good. The boy had a "burning love burger" and it was so good that when I declined a bite, he said "good, I didn't really want to give you one!"  It's been probably close to 10 years, if not more, since I've been to Red Robin....they've always been a decent stand-by. Consistent with what they offer and you know exactly what you'll get.

Although I have eaten here in the past and would probably give them 3 or 4 stars, my experience the last 2 times we have been here has left a sour taste in my mouth.  Let me explain: Approximately 1 week ago, my husband and I were shopping and decided to eat here.  The hostess took us to a small, 2-person booth.  Since it was obvious that 2 people + multiple bags were not going to fit, we asked to be seated at a larger table or booth (restaurant approximately 50% empty.)  The hostess took us to a corner booth that had even less room!  When we indicated once again that we wanted a larger table, she grabbed the menus and "marched" toward the front, telling us that we "we would just have to wait."  Since no one was in line and there were many empty tables, we just said "to heck with it" and went to another restaurant. Today, we decide to go to a movie at the mall.  We noticed that Red Robin had a lot of empty seats so we should have ample time to eat lunch and go to the movie.  When we walked up, we noticed that there were 2 hostesses, one being the same one we had had previously.  After waiting approximately 10 minutes while others were being seated or others went to the bar to eat, our names were called.  Once again, it was the same hostess and she started taking us to the bar.  Since we didn't want to eat at the bar and could have gone there earlier, she took the menus, went back to the front, and proceeded to ignore us while others were called to be seated.  (I know that there was at least 6 empty tables because I could easily see them from the front.) Needless to say, we were not happy campers.  After being ignored and being in a hurry to get to the movies, we left and went somewhere else.  Upon arriving home, I immediately shot off an email to Red Robin corporate letting them know about the treatment that we had received both times at that restaurant by the same "hostess."

I absolutely love Red Robin.  i mean, any place that's gives you an unlimited amount of steak fries deserves an award.  I now present you with the "Steff Likes You" Award! *applause*  Oh yeah, they have a great burgers.  Nice and big with a lot of flavor.  And the special seasons is to die for!  Literally, with all those salts and spices, your bound to get some kind of kidney failure.   The only downside about this place is the service.  The place is always busy, and the waiters tend to forget about you often.  Plus, the place is openly placed inside the mall, so prepare for a bunch of random screaming and loud noises.

I've been here a couple times and although I love the food, they need to improve on their service. They took forever to take our order, and even longer to bring out the food. I do hope that within time they improve their service because the food really is great...

The service was absolutely horrid. I had To go up to a waiter and ASK them I take our order.  Food was typical. But back to the service it took a long time for our food and the waitress Barley ever checked on us . Not the best place if you're in a rush or don't have lots if time on your hands..

Me and my family came here for dinner while in town we had a bit of a hard time finding it since we are not from Fairfield. When we entered the place wasn't too busy the service from our waitress wasn't all that great she never offered me a refill on my drink and she hardly checked up on us. The only good thing was that our food was made fast but the overall presentation of my dish wasn't pretty at my local Red Robin my food looks better as for the taste its good as always. It was also someones birthday there too so the workers sang to the person but it was very loud and annoying when you're trying to enjoy a nice dinner if it was they wern't screaming the happy birthday song at the top of their lungs I wouldn't have gotten annoyed with that.

Great place for some nice burgers and fries!! Clean and service was pretty fast with a full house. Great fries and a variety of burgers and sandwiches and I think I saw some salads and rice bowls on the menu.

Bland food. Our server wasn't mean (though I did hear a sever raise his voice at the couple next to us, no clue what that was about), just rather incompetent. I asked for no tomatoes or pickles, my burger had tomatoes and pickles covered under a big pile of lettuce. My friend asked for no onions, her burger had onions. Two out of three of us did not get our sauce at all. I asked where it was, and he only brought back one of the sauces. It wasn't busy at all, so I don't know what the problem was. My burger was okay. Nothing I would go out of my way for. My two friends let me taste their food, and I still wasn't impressed by anything that passed my lips. If this is the service on a light day, I would hate to go when it's busy. I don't see the big deal about this place at all.

Mediocre service aside, this place has really good burgers. I love the whiskey river burger they have. it is pretty good. the bottomless fries are good too! It would be nice though, if the servers would actually refill the fries (or at least offer to) when they see the basket empty. you have to actually ask for more. Prices are exactly what you would expect for a sit down restaurant, but sometimes you wonder if your getting a real bang for your buck.  I would say 4/5 for the food and 2/5 for service..so i guess 3/5 stars total.

Yes I've experienced better here, WTF happened?  The burger was bad, small and dry.  And definitely over priced, $18 for  a burger, fries and shake.  The shake was a bit on the watery side, I like mine thick.  The fries were the best item hands down.  We would have been better off going to In and Out!

If u go here, be sure to go to the bar, where the REAL waitstaff are.  Yesterday after waiting 30 minutes for our order,  our waitress told me they are out of Turkey burgers. I was a bit taken aback...I had ordered a beef dip sandwich.  I've had bad days. She was having a bad day, but instead of being truthful with us and telling us she screwed up the order, she wandered around the kitchen not knowing what to do. Seeing the commotion, the manager started giving us a load of BS about how they were out of turkey a few minutes ago but not now. My wife stood up and walked away, my son got into the man's 'bubble' and tells him off.  The waitstaff need training and a new manager if they're going to compete in this economy.

Man, I love me some Red Robin Burgers! Always delicious and never lets me down.  The only bad experience I had was when I went in there with my friends, and I saw my ex-girlfriend working there. As much as it was a pleasure to see how low she sank, I lost my appetite after seeing her there. So we left. I doubt she still works there, but if she does, then more power to her! lol

How do write a review that is unique and creative for a chain franchise that everyone and their grandma's been to? Seriously, how do you? Eh, I won't even try to make the attempt because this place is nothing out of the ordinary.  I go here because it is convenient, tasty, and moderately priced. I can say that I do honestly enjoy their chicken wings with ranch, you can get blue cheese with it, but that's just not my thing.  Before or after a movie, you can get some good food and a cold one here. I'd suggest eating here before a movie, that way you can get a better value for your buck than buying theater food.

My server (Robin) has horrible customer service. She asked me is my debit card is real which is under my name with BOA. She needs to go to learn from beginning. Terrible customer service from the Fairfield Solano Mall Red Robin.

Okay, maybe it may sound biased, but I'm trying not to be...I just DJed their Holiday party last night and I must say they are quite a tight bunch (company-wide).  I sat with my buddy Big Joe (Mngr at the Newark location), the Regional Manager, the West Coast Director, and the Vice President of the whole company.  They are very personable I must say.  They all knew how to have a good time.   They gave me a room and food & all.    Anyways, the next day I ate at the Red Robin in Fairfield and they are MUCH different than the ghetto-don't-give-a-damn-what -you-do vibe I used to get there years ago.  Very friendly greeting, very attentive service, and for a chain these burgers are KILLER!  I ordered the Royal Burger which has patty, cheddar, fried egg, bacon, lettuce, tomato, pickles, & mayo.  It also comes with bottomless fries! (but I didn't get any refills on fries).  The burger was PERFECTLY prepared, fries were dee-lish, and the Oreo Cookie Shake was off the chains!  For  a chain of restaurants, this is one excellent place to sit down, and enjoy an excellent burger with great service.  NOTHING like the Red Robin I always rememberd years ago.  If you haven't been to one in a long time, or never for that matter, consider this place for you next burger fix!

Went here last night with my brother who was dropping me off at Travis as I try to make my way home to Spain. Paid $30+ for a fish and chips for him, a sautéed mushroom burger, and sodas. I don't know about his fish and chips which he devoured quite quickly, but my mushroom burger was very tasteless, with just cheese, mushrooms, burger and bun....  quite expensive for just a burger w/o flavor at all, and a fish & chips, and am disgusted with the food. Plus I told the waitress the men's room was in need of cleaning and attention (not in that order) and 20mins later it was still untouched. Aside from almost getting hit by a crazed woman in a red SUV who drove out from one parking lot to another and nearly killing my brother and I by turning in front of us and nearly hitting us, then driving into another lot, turning in front of yet another oncoming vehicle and missing it also by just a few feet  -  the whole experience was frightening and worthless.

This restaurant is pretty good in my opinion the bottomless fries awesome and the burgers taste the same every time the burgers taste the same good. Now the service here is ok we went there one time with some friends and without writing it down he tried to memorize our drinks so the server comes back only to forget some of our drinks he brought back me a Dr.Pepper and I wanted Dr.Pepper so he keeps forgetting then gets all the drinks right.But last time we went there the service was better.So stop here for a quick bite to eat next time your in the area.

Royal Red...yum. Nothing like a fried egg on a burger especially when the yolk is still soft. It sure fixes my burger craves. Fries remind me of old school "bowling alley fries." But its a toss up on the service. Sometimes you get really good or really bad. But what can I say...I'm only there for the Royal Red...

We often eat here, so today I was horrified to see a cockroach crawling along, then up under the wood trim on the wall that boarders the booths. Sadly I wont be coming back. Because if roaches are seen during the day I could only imaging how many come out at night.
stopped in for lunch sat in the bar had great service and the food was on point

Four ghetto mall stars, in groovy trendy SF this would be more like three....a bright clean place, very chain-ish, with decent food and a wide selection of slimeburgers, all at around almost 10 bucks each. They come with tasty "bottomless" fries, and the soft drinks are "bottomless" too, so if you get a good server you can get refills many times over...we happened to be lucky and got a very efficient server who brought us refills without having to be asked...other servers may vary.

I have really, really, really high standards for hamburgers...   Lets just say what you order never really looks like the picture in the menu.   Drinks are watered down.  For 2 of the burgers plus drinks totalled to about $42.   My burger was ok, but the bill was definitely not.  I would have gone to McD's and get 42 double cheeseburgers instead...

Red Robin's wait staff and manager hit a home run with us today.  My son LOVES the clam strips at Red Robin, and has since we first arrived here in California 10 years ago when my son was 5 yrs old, so it is a happy childhood memory for him.  We have tried to order the clam strips, which are always awesome by the way, for the past couple of visits, but they are no longer on the menu as a standard item.  We were told they would be on the menu in April so we came back today for lunch, and oh no, they won't be on the menu until April 16 and today is the 11th.  Bummer.  I told our waitress we were really bummed and that Red Robin should put the clam strips back on the menu full time.  We ordered our meals and were waiting for them and the manager came to our table, told us he loves the clam strips too and made it happen!  He had them in the freezer ready for the Saturday launch and threw a batch in the fryer just for us.  He comped us an order of clam strips.  Here is what my 15 yr old son learned:  Good business and customer service goes a long way and he commented on how cool the manager was.  It was such a sweet and nice thing to do,   I paid it forward and gave our waitress a 30% tip. I really like the way Red Robin is customer service oriented and the quality of their meals is worth the price.  We will be back, and often, especially for the clam strips.

My fiancee and I are huge Red Robin fans. Our children are also fans. We visited this location yesterday; before catching a movie. The service wasn't the best; we had to request and wait for our silverware after we were served our food. The food was wonderful; as usual. I tried the Oriental Chicken Salad for the first time. It was one of the best I have ever had. Fresh greens and grilled chicken, with light dressing. I will order this again. My fiancee ordered a chicken sandwich with the endless fries. The garlic fries are the bomb! I think by his third basket the waitress started getting tired of him. The kids always get the chili and no complaints from them.

I went here to celebrate my nieces b-day w/her friends, my sister and her family. We were accomodated within 15 minutes compared to BJ's Brewhouse in Vacaville. The staff were a little overwhelmed but still friendly and trying the best they can to serve all the people coming in and people who are waiting to order their food.  My sister and I split the salad w/the poppy seed honey mustard sauce which is plenty enough for two people. Seems like everybody ordered salad - must be a health kick - the kids usually order hamburger after playing soccer earlier in the day but ...... teenagers trying to look good - oh well what can we say...... For appetizer, we ordered hot wings w/ranch and blue cheese dressing, onion rings and the artichoke w/tortilla chips - Nothing special - they all taste the same - Chili's and BJ's Drinks i.e., lemonade - same as BJ's and Chili's - nothing special  Located in the mall and easy access to the theater and the mall.  This is the first time I've been in this location. There's one by my place in San Bruno and I have not tried this location yet. One day!

If i was put in the situation where i could only eat at one sports bar chain for the rest of my life, i'd choose red robin.  It's like applebee's only better.  I went there saturday with my parents before the movies.  While i was getting kinda grumpy because my dad was being a prick, i was getting ready to write a nasty review in my head because my drink was slow to arrive and it was ALL ice and then no one would look at me for me to ask for another drink.  When lo and behold, a new drink, with less ice showed up at my table for me.  I was happy again!!  Now, normally, i order the bonzai burger, teriyaki sauce with cheddar and pineapple.  Yes i eat hamburgers with pineapple on them, don't knock it till you try it!  Well, this time, i wanted to try something different that i'd seen... the jamaica jerked chicken sandwich, jerk chicken breast, pineapple, mango mayo, pepper jack cheese on a jalepeno/corn bun... it was a good diversion from my regular choice.  In fact, while i was writing the review in my head of this dining experience while dining, the sandwich got the primary focus.  It was so flippin good!!  now, next time i go there, i don't know which i'll get... they are both so good!!  And the service redeemed itself once my drink showed up, even though i thought they were ignoring me.
There's nothing special about this place. Their sandwich/burgers taste like any sand/burger place. Nothing to jump up and down about.

I've eaten here a number of times and can say I've never had a bad experience.  Service has always been OK to really good and always liked their food.  I was actually happy that they opened one in Fairfield.  They have great burgers, love the bottomless fries and freckled lemonade.  I've never had to wait long at a red robins and it's even a cool place to get a few drinks at the bar.  Sometimes there's a lot of traffic in and out of red robin cuz a lot of people cut through the place to enter or leave the mall.  But if you're in the mall and want a good burger, go to Red Robbin.

Red Robin is a chain and being so they should all be pretty standard in their food quality.  Unfortunately this Red Rob gets a pitiful 2 stars.  The first week my husband and I moved to this area we decided to check out the mall and get a bite to eat.  We decided to go to Red Robin because the one in San Diego (where we lived) wasn't that great (although the one in VA is AWESOME).  Well, unfortunately, this one is on the same level as the one in San Diego.  First, I asked for cheddar cheese on my burger, instead of Swiss (hate Swiss), and lo and behold it had Swiss on it, when it came out.  Second, everything was greasy! It was gross!  As I held my burger I had grease going down my hand.  Obviously, I didn't finish it.  Finally, our check was messed up when we got it. We got charged for things that we didn't even order.  Seriously?!  Lame.  Yes, this review is partly to blame on the lame waiter we had but also on the overly greasy food we got.  So, if you're looking for a casual burger place to eat... keep going and find somewhere else.

So one night my boyfriend and i took his lil sister to dinner with us. The service honesty SUCKS!!! Even though they were about to close we got the worst service. We didn't even get utensils. I had to walk up and get it myself. the tables weren't clean. It took awhile to get our re-frills! You'd think that if you go right before they close you would get great service. Guess wrong!
had terrible service and terrible food once....not a great place...kinda ghetto.
